commit_message:
Baseclass for ModelBuilder with audit scope

This lets all the ModelBuilder classes use one baseclass and forces
ClusterDataModelCollector's to pass the scope.

The scopes are still unused in the case of Ironic and Cinder.

The idea is to do several follow ups to this and in the end have a
similar method to query_retry in the datasources baseclass.

Change-Id: Ibbdedd3087fef5298d7f4c9d3abdba05d1fbb2f0

commit_message:
Add placement client for neutron

This is required if segmented provider networks are used in a cloud.
Neutron looks up which compute nodes are associated with each segment
with the placement API.

Change-Id: I7e8c0e3ef7aefd0574aa2a28560653005f2640d6
Related-Bug: 1818943
(cherry picked from commit 2cafbd1ae35b5fce3ba5c88c1c8d59937ca1eb46)

commit_message:
Move datasources folder into decision_engine

The datasources are only used by the decision_engine, however, they
are placed in a directory one level higher. This patch moves the
datasources code into the decision_engine folder.

Change-Id: Ia54531fb899b79a59bb77adea079ff27c0d518fa

commit_message:
[WIP]Transition load balancer flows DB objects to dicts

For now, just split of PoC patch. Will be organized in
series of patches with refactor, that won't be breaking anything.

Loadbalancer flows use listener, pool, member and amphora
flows. So loadbalancer flows can be translated properly
after them.

Change-Id: I3b378e80e2797fb89c55264f03673f420bee598d
Story: 2005072
Task: 30807

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-11 13:40:05.000000000', 'message': 'Hash Ring: Add support for groups

This patch adds support for groups in the Hash Ring mechanism.

Prior to this patch there was an assumption that all members of the ring
were able to handle the same events but, once we start expanding the use
of the hash ring on different parts of the code such as the Octavia
driver, that assumption is not true anymore because they have their own
events.

With the group mechanism, multiple groups can be created (resulting in a
separated hash ring for each group) that way we can group workers based
on the events they are able to handle.

This patch includes a new migration script that adds a new column called
"group_name" to the "ovn_hash_ring" table.

Change-Id: Ifc489afb764cddeec58597399d7d641c0d7ff279
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
'}, {'created': '2019-07-11 14:51:09.000000000', 'message': 'Hash Ring: Add support for groups

commit_message:
Hash Ring: Add support for groups

This patch adds support for groups in the Hash Ring mechanism.

Prior to this patch there was an assumption that all members of the ring
were able to handle the same events but, once we start expanding the use
of the hash ring on different parts of the code such as the Octavia
driver, that assumption is not true anymore because they have their own
events.

With the group mechanism, multiple groups can be created (resulting in a
separated hash ring for each group) that way we can group workers based
on the events they are able to handle.

This patch includes a new migration script that adds a new column called
"group_name" to the "ovn_hash_ring" table.

Change-Id: Ifc489afb764cddeec58597399d7d641c0d7ff279
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Scale up logic with extra IP addresses for pcs 0.10

Nowadays we can provide IP addresses when adding a host into a
pacemaker cluster. The pcmk_cluster_setup function for initial setup
of the cluster has this already implemented, but it was still missing
from the pcmk_nodes_added function and the scale-up logic. Support for
scaling up with pcs 0.10 and the explicitly provided IP addresses is
being added in this commit.

Change-Id: If5baef83c739c7ccdbe346c75401f232ab092d20
Closes-Bug: #1835217
Related-Bug: #1831690

commit_message:
Add tripleo-build-images-base job & reparent existing build jobs

This is so we can use the base as parent in the rdo periodic
pipeline. Tracked by oooci squad @ [1]

[1] https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/task/1151

Change-Id: Idf07b528f8f34a31e93585dcbf5cb90f8c7928dd

- dellemc-poweredge-R740-R640-UEFI-tempest-dsvm-ironic-ipmi https://stash.dellemc-community.org/logs/dellemc-poweredge-R740-R640-UEFI-tempest-dsvm-ironic-ipmi/2019-07-15:16:37/670876/1/ : FAILURE in 39m 07s'}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2019-07-16 07:21:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

there is no version change in other dependencies, and yes, these are secondary dependencies
the problem is that we have lower constraints versions that are not compatible with other projects (openstacksdk and python-glanceclient in this case), and this might cause issues.
One solution, as Dmitry said, would be to leave just the direct dependencies in lower-constraints.
I'm totally for it and can just change the scope of the patch if needed"}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-07-16 08:28:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> there is no version change in other dependencies, and yes, these
 > are secondary dependencies
 > the problem is that we have lower constraints versions that are not
 > compatible with other projects (openstacksdk and python-glanceclient
 > in this case), and this might cause issues.
 > One solution, as Dmitry said, would be to leave just the direct
 > dependencies in lower-constraints.
 > I'm totally for it and can just change the scope of the patch if
 > needed

If we have a lower minimum than a secondary dependency, wouldn't the requirement from that dependency bump our secondary when it gets installed?

e.g.

pip install secondary>1
pip install primary

where primary has secondary>2 in requirements.txt

That should cause secondary to get bumped to >2, unless pip is completely inept (which isn't impossible)."}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2019-07-16 13:38:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> If we have a lower minimum than a secondary dependency, wouldn't the requirement from that dependency bump our secondary when it gets installed?

For usual requirements it works this way (although pip is pretty bad at it). With constraints, if we have secondary==1, seeing secondary>2 will cause a failure IIRC."}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-07-16 14:10:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> > If we have a lower minimum than a secondary dependency, wouldn't
 > the requirement from that dependency bump our secondary when it
 > gets installed?
 > 
 > For usual requirements it works this way (although pip is pretty
 > bad at it). With constraints, if we have secondary==1, seeing
 > secondary>2 will cause a failure IIRC.

Aren't those two compatible? These are lower constraints."}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2019-07-16 15:24:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

it depends what you mean with "compatible", yes they work, no they're not recommended and could cause issues with the lower constraints versions.
This is what you get running the tests with what we have now:
ERROR: openstacksdk 0.25.0 has requirement keystoneauth1>=3.11.0, but you'll have keystoneauth1 3.4.0 which is incompatible.
ERROR: python-glanceclient 2.8.0 has requirement warlock!=1.3.0,<2,>=1.0.1, but you'll have warlock 1.3.0 which is incompatible.

IMHO in this case the test should fail, but it doesn't, so it's kind of hard to notice.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2019-07-16 16:44:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Aren't those two compatible? These are lower constraints.

Right, but in the lower-constraints job they're applied *together*, at the same time."}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2019-07-17 09:12:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 19339, 'date': '2019-07-18 00:42:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

When task/role files are included using include_tasks, tags are not
passed to the included tasks. As a result, tags like swift-config
do not have the intended effect. This patch changes include_tasks
to import_tasks for all cases where dynamic vars or loops are not used

commit_message:
Convert dynamic includes to static imports

When task/role files are included using include_tasks, tags are not
passed to the included tasks. As a result, tags like swift-config
do not have the intended effect. This patch changes include_tasks
to import_tasks for all cases where dynamic vars or loops are not used
so that tags are properly handled.

Reference -
https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/user_guide/playbooks_reuse.html
https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-ansible/+bug/1815043

Change-Id: I7553c3ef4d7620844f614da79b2cb1086eda23cb

commit_message:
Convert dynamic includes to static imports

When task/role files are included using include_tasks, tags are not
passed to the included tasks. As a result, tags like neutron-config
do not have the intended effect. This patch changes include_tasks
to import_tasks for all cases where dynamic vars or loops are not used
so that tags are properly handled.

Reference -
https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/user_guide/playbooks_reuse.html
https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-ansible/+bug/1815043

Change-Id: I7c4c7e6887cc756998ce028355402705a45e18ed

commit_message:
Ensure domain info is in CloudComputeContext

Ensure domain info is in CloudComputeContext. The nova.conf template
is already setup to render the domain if it present.

There is aslo a drive-by fix to two unit tests which were failing
locally due to a missing mock.

Change-Id: I4f2fd2cf7fcfbb009589907ce1f6245f0121ecd9
Cloaes-Bug: 1830536

commit_message:
Provide compute nodes with domain information

The domain is missing from the credentials that nova cloud
controller passes to the compute nodes. This change adds it in.

Closes-Bug: 1830536
Change-Id: I2ad82b9b271d83e1b49691187c620d7b976e5ff0

[{'created': '2019-07-16 08:09:40.000000000', 'message': "Processing available Ansible variables as 'parameters' not as 'metadata'

Before this patch, all the available Ansible variables for each
validations coming from tripleo-validations were considered as
'metadata' which should only contain the following informations:

```
vars:
  metadata:
    name: ...
    description: ...
    groups: ...
```

This patch clarifies this by classifying all the potential variables as
'parameters' instead of 'metadata'.

Change-Id: I7b65b73722ebe0462eb86265197b456e8c77ed13
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit aa8132b7364aaa509fa470fdf327bb0111bf7169)
"}]
commit_message:
Processing available Ansible variables as 'parameters' not as 'metadata'

Before this patch, all the available Ansible variables for each
validations coming from tripleo-validations were considered as
'metadata' which should only contain the following informations:

```
vars:
  metadata:
    name: ...
    description: ...
    groups: ...
```

This patch clarifies this by classifying all the potential variables as
'parameters' instead of 'metadata'.

Change-Id: I7b65b73722ebe0462eb86265197b456e8c77ed13
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit aa8132b7364aaa509fa470fdf327bb0111bf7169)

[{'created': '2019-07-16 08:09:40.000000000', 'message': 'Get all the available Ansible variables for each validations

All the Ansible variables in the validations playbooks must be at the
same level as the metadata and not part of them.

```
- hosts: myhost
  vars:
    metadata:
      name: Validation name
      description: What should this validation do...
      groups:
        - prep
        - pre-deployment
    variable1: "value1"
    variable2: "value2"
    ...
```

Change-Id: Ib3d9ea8d9f85ea194a16feacb530d50419d7e54a
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 569217425974c47314fe27fb91f6c006c3445bb3)
'}]
commit_message:
Get all the available Ansible variables for each validations

All the Ansible variables in the validations playbooks must be at the
same level as the metadata and not part of them.

```
- hosts: myhost
  vars:
    metadata:
      name: Validation name
      description: What should this validation do...
      groups:
        - prep
        - pre-deployment
    variable1: "value1"
    variable2: "value2"
    ...
```

Change-Id: Ib3d9ea8d9f85ea194a16feacb530d50419d7e54a
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 569217425974c47314fe27fb91f6c006c3445bb3)

commit_message:
Switch neutron tempest jobs to run only networking related tests

In commit [1] neutron replaced using "integrated-gate" template with
new "integrated-gate-networking" tempate to run only tests related
to Neutron and Nova in Neutron CI.

This patch switches tempest jobs defined in neutron directly:
* neutron-tempest-dvr
* neutron-tempest-linuxbridge
* neutron-tempest-iptables_hybrid
* neutron-tempest-with-uwsgi

to inherit from this new "tempest-integrated-networking" job and
run also only tests related to Neutron and Nova.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/669815/

Change-Id: I2aa60fa1aa98e79f8b2597e490c00f7410f2a93d

commit_message:
Adds some dib_ overrides for image build - used for rhel8 jobs

This adds some more dib_ overrides into the image build jinja
template that are passed from the rhel8 job [1] and used here to
export DIB variables before build. Tracked by tripleo-ci squad [2]

[1] https://review.rdoproject.org/r/21357
[2] https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/task/1151

Change-Id: Ib3ef4c45ce8bed82661b2da7621a8f4ab4a23fa9

commit_message:
improve intel FPGA driver

When a FPGA attach to a vm, the fpga information in sysfs will
disappear.

Improve it.

Change-Id: I780a684fc418bb427c183b2b192686eed0e117dc

commit_message:
Add Python 3 Train unit tests

This is a mechanically generated patch to ensure unit testing is in place
for all of the Tested Runtimes for Train.

See the Train python3-updates goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/python3-updates.html

Note: This diverges from the Train goal as it does not drop the
openstack-python35-jobs. As tempest is branchless it needs to continue
supporting Python 3.5.

Change-Id: Ie702ca637afb8229b6e605abcec25550bc9a0673
Story: #2005924
Task: #34240

commit_message:
Add local bindep.txt

As it was announced [1] global bindep-fallback.txt was removed and now
projects need to have a local bindep.txt to be able to install binary
dependencies for testing.

In documentation zuul job graphviz package ('dot' command) is needed.
Without that the job fails with:
    dot command 'dot' cannot be run (needed for graphviz output),
    check the graphviz_dot setting

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-June/007272.html

(cherry picked from commit feac47186d79569bb564e18216e07f18ed5ccd8b)
(cherry picked from commit caf65ed26066b5f7d13cc50e67f1df852414b2dc)

Conflicts:
      doc/requirements.txt
      test-requirements.txt
Note(elod.illes): conflict is due to not having proposal bot's updates
from global requirements.

Change-Id: I5efddfc72e9dc0dd1b8b9e1e37708e1d30ef3c39
(cherry picked from commit 39f61e4392ef3c0f1852b87a9d2cb0bc4f410bec)
(cherry picked from commit f10075c4b36cd2375234e8bb93247be13869332a)

commit_message:
Add local bindep.txt

As it was announced [1] global bindep-fallback.txt was removed and now
projects need to have a local bindep.txt to be able to install binary
dependencies for testing.

In documentation zuul job graphviz package ('dot' command) is needed.
Without that the job fails with:
    dot command 'dot' cannot be run (needed for graphviz output),
    check the graphviz_dot setting

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-June/007272.html

(cherry picked from commit feac47186d79569bb564e18216e07f18ed5ccd8b)
(cherry picked from commit caf65ed26066b5f7d13cc50e67f1df852414b2dc)

Conflicts:
      tox.ini
Note(elod.illes): conflict is due to that lower-constraints tox env is
not present in Queens. Also patch needed to fix different errors as in
Queens the basepython is 2.7 which needs sphinx requirements to be
updated and does not need sphinx logging deprecation fix as in Rocky.

Change-Id: I5efddfc72e9dc0dd1b8b9e1e37708e1d30ef3c39
(cherry picked from commit 39f61e4392ef3c0f1852b87a9d2cb0bc4f410bec)

commit_message:
Bump the openstackdocstheme extension to 1.20

Some options are now automatically configured by the version 1.20:
- project
- html_last_updated_fmt
- latex_engine
- latex_elements
- version
- release.

Change-Id: I1331abaf1c99a4631ccde3e9fbb70085ca3dcd4e

subject: Support multi-arch in deploy image validations
messages:
[{'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2019-06-20 20:54:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2019-06-20 20:56:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

Still a bit of a WIP. At the very least, I need to do some more (manual) testing.

I didn't make any changes to code in the "validations" folder (the 'old' code).'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-06-20 22:48:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)

Thanks Jeremy ... overall this is looking pretty darn good.  I have a couple of comments.'}, {'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2019-06-21 20:36:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

In reference to the whole no-more-glance thing, first let me say: ah, okay.

But, I also will say:
- we surely want to support the new situation (no glance) in these validations generally (and of course for multi-arch)
- we also probably still want to fix the old situation (glance) in these validations for multi-arch, because as far as I can tell the new situation (no glance) will only apply to Train+

My thought is therefore, do two patches-- first do it for the old way (glance) and backport to Stein, and then on top of that do some new-way (no glance) enhancements on master for Train. Right? Because having these validations work for multi-arch on Stein would be nice. 

And seems also to be the case that validations against Train need to check both the glance and no-glance cases... python-tripleoclient already had its first Train release without 663891 merged'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-06-21 23:02:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> In reference to the whole no-more-glance thing, first let me say:
 > ah, okay.
 > 
 > But, I also will say:
 > - we surely want to support the new situation (no glance) in these
 > validations generally (and of course for multi-arch)
 > - we also probably still want to fix the old situation (glance) in
 > these validations for multi-arch, because as far as I can tell the
 > new situation (no glance) will only apply to Train+
 > 
 > My thought is therefore, do two patches-- first do it for the old
 > way (glance) and backport to Stein, and then on top of that do some
 > new-way (no glance) enhancements on master for Train. Right?
 > Because having these validations work for multi-arch on Stein would
 > be nice.

Totally.  What you're describing is pretty much what I meant by "be careful" just with more words and thought ;P
 
 > And seems also to be the case that validations against Train need
 > to check both the glance and no-glance cases... python-tripleoclient
 > already had its first Train release without 663891 merged

Yup.'}, {'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2019-07-01 17:38:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2019-07-02 16:35:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2019-07-03 13:52:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 11491, 'date': '2019-07-05 16:53:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 11491, 'date': '2019-07-05 16:58:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Jeremy, thanks for your patch!

I've tested it on a minimal installation with oooq and it failed:

```
(undercloud) [stack@undercloud ~]$ run-validations.sh  --validation-name ironic-boot-configuration
No handlers could be found for logger "ironicclient.client"
Task 'ironic-boot-configuration : Check ironic boot config' failed:
Host: undercloud
Message: 
Node 1196e2ff-9993-4fee-85a7-67c773b397b8 has an incorrectly configured driver_info/deploy_ramdisk. Got file:///var/lib/ironic/httpboot/agent.ramdisk, but cannot validate because could not find any suitable ramdisk images in Glance.
Node 8b264d89-9ca7-47cb-a4b6-257268d65bbf has an incorrectly configured driver_info/deploy_ramdisk. Got file:///var/lib/ironic/httpboot/agent.ramdisk, but cannot validate because could not find any suitable ramdisk images in Glance.
Node 1196e2ff-9993-4fee-85a7-67c773b397b8 has an incorrectly configured driver_info/deploy_kernel. Got file:///var/lib/ironic/httpboot/agent.kernel, but cannot validate because could not find any suitable kernel images in Glance.
Node 8b264d89-9ca7-47cb-a4b6-257268d65bbf has an incorrectly configured driver_info/deploy_kernel. Got file:///var/lib/ironic/httpboot/agent.kernel, but cannot validate because could not find any suitable kernel images in Glance.

Failure! The validation failed for all hosts:
* undercloud
```

Is that failure correct/logical to you?'}, {'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2019-07-05 17:18:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Hey Gael,
Thanks for testing it locally.

Ideally I want to keep this patch as-is, only looking for images in Glance (not the new file:// stuff recently introduced) because I'm really aiming to backport this to Stein.
I am currently working on a followup patch which will work for file:// images for Train and later.

By the way, I'm wondering what the usual backport considerations usually are for tripleo-validations? In this patch I have introduced some breaking changes, like changing some vars and deleting the deployment-images validation entirely. Is that still okay to backport?"}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2019-07-08 08:46:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Side note: I'd like to get rid of per-node deploy kernel/ramdisk: https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2006175"}, {'account_id': 11491, 'date': '2019-07-08 09:12:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Jeremy Freudberg wrote:

> Hey Gael, Thanks for testing it locally.
>
> Ideally I want to keep this patch as-is, only looking for images in
> Glance (not the new file:// stuff recently introduced) because I'm
> really aiming to backport this to Stein. I am currently working on a
> followup patch which will work for file:// images for Train and
> later.

No blockers here, got it!

> By the way, I'm wondering what the usual backport considerations
> usually are for tripleo-validations? In this patch I have introduced
> some breaking changes, like changing some vars and deleting the
> deployment-images validation entirely. Is that still okay to
> backport?

We don't have any strong backporting rules. So if you think that patch
"as-is" should target Stein, then no blockers from me for backporting
it to Stein where it should belong!

Good work Jeremy and thanks again for this patch and the follow-up one!'}, {'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2019-07-12 20:22:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 11491, 'date': '2019-07-18 11:27:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 11491, 'date': '2019-07-18 14:33:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2019-07-18 14:56:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

another follow-up would be to add "gather_facts: no" to the playbook if no fact is used :).

Thank you for that hard work!'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-07-19 03:55:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1

Looks good to me from a multi-arch POV

Thanks Jeremy'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-07-19 03:55:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 11491, 'date': '2019-07-19 09:23:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/stein as commit 04466f9ec58161d1c3891c5df7b9477f4925cbf5'}]

commit_message:
Support multi-arch in deploy image validations

Previously:
- expect one kernel image and one ramdisk image
- expect every overcloud node to use the same kernel and and ramdisk

Now:
- expect any number of kernel/ramdisk images
- expect each overcloud node to use the most suitable kernel/ramdisk in
  accordance with arch/platform of that node (but recognizing that,
  for any given node, the form that the "most suitable" image takes may
  vary)

Currently only Glance images are considered; support for file images as
introduced in Train will come in a subsequent patch.

Blueprint: multiarch-support

Change-Id: I5a49b60fd32d9032b4dec1a01a3fdad6fddf42aa

'}, {'created': '2019-07-18 11:34:00.000000000', 'message': "Run functional test correctly

legacy-neutronclient-test-dsvm-functional job actually runs
neutronclient.tests.unit because .stestr.conf does not honor
OS_TEST_PATH. This commit fixes .stestr.conf to honor OS_TEST_PATH
specified in tox.ini.

Also fixes the logic of is_extension_enabled() in ClientTestBase
to check whether FWaaS v1 (fwaas) is enabled correctly.
Previously the logic checks a substring of a specified extension,
so 'fwaas' (FWaaS v1) matches 'fwaas_v2' (FWaaS v2),
which leads to a failure of FWaaS v1 CLI tests.

Change-Id: I958ad496b16cca8d03a7b84ebf5f8f031e4248ea
"}]
commit_message:
Run functional test correctly

legacy-neutronclient-test-dsvm-functional job actually runs
neutronclient.tests.unit because .stestr.conf does not honor
OS_TEST_PATH. This commit fixes .stestr.conf to honor OS_TEST_PATH
specified in tox.ini.

Also fixes the logic of is_extension_enabled() in ClientTestBase
to check whether FWaaS v1 (fwaas) is enabled correctly.
Previously the logic checks a substring of a specified extension,
so 'fwaas' (FWaaS v1) matches 'fwaas_v2' (FWaaS v2),
which leads to a failure of FWaaS v1 CLI tests.

Change-Id: I958ad496b16cca8d03a7b84ebf5f8f031e4248ea

commit_message:
Do not recreate Blazar DB if using preconfigured

Most other services already gate the DB bootstrap operations with the
'use_preconfigured_databases' variable; Blazar did not.

Change-Id: I772b1cb92612c7e6936f052ed9947f93582f264c

commit_message:
Set HieradataVars as group vars instead

Instead of writing a set of vars to hieradata_vars.yaml and then passing
that into tasks with vars_files, just set the data as group vars.

This makes for a simpler interface without having to remember to pass in
the data with vars_files on any task/play that might require them.

Change-Id: I851d9404861d55791bde1346c58bc1c94f591569

commit_message:
Remove tripleo_ssh_known_hosts_use_template var

This var is no longer required to pass into the tripleo-ssh-known-hosts
role as using the template will be the only mode going forward.

Change-Id: I0bde2ac03edf26f5594381caa9542aa1eefd8f20
Depends-On: I4a2002fa42337e115f9679fcf2f2db71308389d6

commit_message:
Fix schema validation when providing target

Checks have been added for additional files besides the deliverables. A
specific deliverable file can be specified with the command, but even
when doing so, the updates would still check these other data files.
This updates the handling to only check those files if one was not
provided.

Also small pep257 update.

Change-Id: I80e96319d8f7377db67a336d5c1a5569d75007a1
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
List deliverables not released since given date

Allow list_deliverables to filter output to list only deliverables
that have not been released since a given date (--unreleased-since).

This will be useful to compile list of libraries to autorelease at
milestones, or check for cycle-with-intermediary services that may
need a refresh release.

Additionally, if --show-dates is provided, the dates for last releases
(or all releases if -a option is provided) will be retrieved (and
displayed if in verbose mode).

Retrieving release dates is done through querying opendev's API for
tag references and looking at committer dates, so it requires Internet
access and increases command run time. It is only enabled if
--show_dates or --unreleased-since are enabled.

Task: 35684
Change-Id: I00aff6703e85a00572edb363973c92b883a79456

The list of tags associated with a deliverable is rarely useful, and yet

commit_message:
Make display of tags optional

The list of tags associated with a deliverable is rarely useful, and yet
takes up massive horizontal space in verbose mode. In preparation for
adding more columns, make display of tags optional.

Change-Id: Id0946a6bbf86e79a4ba2a613c6950e3dd352cf80

[{'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2019-07-18 02:27:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2019-07-18 08:59:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I don't think this is the right path to take, unless we want to add similar retries to literally every openstack call. We need to find the root cause of connection problems. If it's a resource starvation, the downstream CI may simply beef up their VMs/nodes."}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2019-07-19 04:55:15.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Evidence points to inspector being resource constrained to respond to the request, but there is more going on here.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-18 02:27:22.000000000', 'message': 'Add a retry for wait_for_introspection_to_finish

Downstream CI has seen ConnectFailure exceptions raised during this
task, presumably due to load on the ironic-inspector node. This change
adds a retry period of 10 seconds for 10 attempts to account for
transient request failures.

Change-Id: Ia467710aee565f25cd0a578375fc91ed027fdf0c
Closes-Bug: #1836976
'}]
commit_message:
Add a retry for wait_for_introspection_to_finish

Downstream CI has seen ConnectFailure exceptions raised during this
task, presumably due to load on the ironic-inspector node. This change
adds a retry period of 10 seconds for 10 attempts to account for
transient request failures.

Change-Id: Ia467710aee565f25cd0a578375fc91ed027fdf0c
Closes-Bug: #1836976

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-18 18:42:22.000000000', 'message': 'Add galaxy role path which will be ignored by git

This change will ensure that local testing, with online roles installed
via galaxy, are not creating a dirty git tree. To build the separation
an empty directory "roles.galaxy" has been added which the galaxy command
will use to install external roles. All of the role path settings have
been updated to accomodate this new directory.

Change-Id: If68fa43231b2efbcdc046070a098bd49f47cfdb2
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Add galaxy role path which will be ignored by git

This change will ensure that local testing, with online roles installed
via galaxy, are not creating a dirty git tree. To build the separation
an empty directory "roles.galaxy" has been added which the galaxy command
will use to install external roles. All of the role path settings have
been updated to accomodate this new directory.

Change-Id: If68fa43231b2efbcdc046070a098bd49f47cfdb2
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-17 09:17:06.000000000', 'message': "Add swift_config puppet-tag for swift-ringbuilder

ConfigParser in python3 is not happy with the default
config(contain %%) shipped with swift package[1]. So while applying
puppet manifest for swift-ringbuilder default config from
package is used(as swift_config tag doesn't exist in puppet-tags),
this patch adds it, so swift-ringbuilder uses the generated config
instead of package defaults.

[1] https://github.com/rdo-packages/swift-distgit/blob/rpm-master/swift.conf

Closes-Bug: #1836572
Change-Id: I737b85393e9ce13bda279dc0388bf27bd979af42
"}]
commit_message:
Add swift_config puppet-tag for swift-ringbuilder

ConfigParser in python3 is not happy with the default
config(contain %%) shipped with swift package[1]. So while applying
puppet manifest for swift-ringbuilder default config from
package is used(as swift_config tag doesn't exist in puppet-tags),
this patch adds it, so swift-ringbuilder uses the generated config
instead of package defaults.

[1] https://github.com/rdo-packages/swift-distgit/blob/rpm-master/swift.conf

Closes-Bug: #1836572
Change-Id: I737b85393e9ce13bda279dc0388bf27bd979af42

commit_message:
Skip standalone deploys if tox jobs fail

We've excluded most jobs from running if the tox jobs fail but we were
still running the standalone jobs. Let's skip those too if pep8 or the
unit tests fail.

Change-Id: I2a58cd0244aefbe1202f610fcaa9af1f98e5f847

commit_message:
Use ansible_pkg_mgr fact instead of hardcoding yum command

This patch adds support for 'dnf' and 'yum' command in the repos role by
using the 'ansible_pkg_mgr' fact.

Change-Id: I5f9ea00d8c2c438b16d28f7de91c2ac79fd01228
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit e69d7b9ff892997d65cdfd1844a4d08339394df6)

commit_message:
Ensure files are closed, ensure no ResourceWarning on console

Fixes an issue wich cause warnings such as the one below on the
console when using python3.
  ResourceWarning : unclosed file <_io.TextIOWrapper name='FILENAME'

Closes-Bug: #1836379
Change-Id: I4a80a339b2cc0c3fca992cfc456581a91dbf2eef
(cherry picked from commit 317f3cff7d00d9031a482e26d9149bca6010677c)

commit_message:
Rabbit: Eradicate potential crashes in wait job while upgrading cluster

When upgrading/reconfiguring a rabbit cluster its possible that the nodes
will not return the cluster status for some time, this ps allows us to
cope with this much more gracefully than simply crashing a few times, before
proceeding.

Change-Id: Ibf525df9e3a9362282f70e5dbb136430734181fd
Signed-off-by: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-17 17:42:33.000000000', 'message': "Move rc_cache onto RequestContext

Experimentation led to the discovery (as described in the story
noted below) that the global RC_CACHE is not safe in a multi-process
environment, which is common for a web service designed to scale
horizontally.

In rare circumstances it is possible for a custom resource class
to be deleted in one process but still appear to exist in another.
For many situations this wouldn't really matter, but there are
cases, even more rare, where it would be possible to write allocations
or resource provider inventory using the wrong resource class
id.

On the related story, a variety of options were discussed to fix
this. Reading through the code this one (which is option 2) was
the only one that proved workable in a relatively straightforward
fashion: Have a per request cache.

To that end, when a RequestContext is created (per request) the
resource class table is scanned to create a cache. Because the
context is local to this request, we no longer need to do any
locking around the cache, either when we create it or when we clear
it: The caller is linear.

The cost of this is that now every single request starts with a
scan of the resource class table. This isn't horrible: if we
had no cache at all we'd be reading rows from that table multiple
times throughout any request (read or write).

We should probably do some performance analysis to see what the
impact of this might be. The perfload jobs may be able to give
a limited sense of what the impact is, but profiling will be
required for accuracy.

It is the case that the functional tests seem a bit slower because
of that additional db query.

Change-Id: I409a5e819a72d64e66ee390e4528da0c503d8d05
Story: 2006232
Task: 35833
"}, {'created': '2019-07-18 10:05:02.000000000', 'message': "Move rc_cache onto RequestContext

noted below) that the global RC_CACHE is not safe in a multi-process
environment, which is common for a web service designed to scale

resource class table is scanned to create a cache. Because the
context is local to this request, we no longer need to do any

it: The caller is linear.

The cost of this is that now every single request starts with a
scan of the resource class table. This isn't horrible: if we
had no cache at all we'd be reading rows from that table multiple
times throughout any request (read or write).

We should probably do some performance analysis to see what the
impact of this might be. The perfload jobs may be able to give
a limited sense of what the impact is, but profiling will be
required for accuracy.

It is the case that the functional tests seem a bit slower because
of that additional db query.

Change-Id: I409a5e819a72d64e66ee390e4528da0c503d8d05
Story: 2006232
Task: 35833
"}]
commit_message:
Move rc_cache onto RequestContext

Experimentation led to the discovery (as described in the story
noted below) that the global RC_CACHE is not safe in a multi-process
environment, which is common for a web service designed to scale
horizontally.

In rare circumstances it is possible for a custom resource class
to be deleted in one process but still appear to exist in another.
For many situations this wouldn't really matter, but there are
cases, even more rare, where it would be possible to write allocations
or resource provider inventory using the wrong resource class
id.

On the related story, a variety of options were discussed to fix
this. Reading through the code this one (which is option 2) was
the only one that proved workable in a relatively straightforward
fashion: Have a per request cache.

To that end, when a RequestContext is created (per request) the
resource class table is scanned to create a cache. Because the
context is local to this request, we no longer need to do any
locking around the cache, either when we create it or when we clear
it: The caller is linear.

The cost of this is that now every single request starts with a
scan of the resource class table. This isn't horrible: if we
had no cache at all we'd be reading rows from that table multiple
times throughout any request (read or write).

We should probably do some performance analysis to see what the
impact of this might be. The perfload jobs may be able to give
a limited sense of what the impact is, but profiling will be
required for accuracy.

It is the case that the functional tests seem a bit slower because
of that additional db query.

Change-Id: I409a5e819a72d64e66ee390e4528da0c503d8d05
Story: 2006232
Task: 35833

commit_message:
Allow logrotate to access container_file_t files

Since we write logs directly from within containers, logrotate must be
able to access them.

Change-Id: I2a06cdcda92b2839d74373d6978ef65e7b4dedbd
Closes-Bug: #1836000
(cherry picked from commit b81bec56f27f08cc4a6f81416aad422a15bd3ce7)
(cherry picked from commit c8ad086ba15d7a3b757662d03e74a05b49f43a39)
(cherry picked from commit 0d991c9e1c180a7bd55267a02d8821fda1efb459)

commit_message:
Tidy up tripleo-standalone-scenarios-full template with anchors

Uses yaml anchors to tidy up the files: in the standlone template
especially scen 1-4 to avoid duplication between check and gate

commit_message:
Make Bionic the default for the Amphora

This patch switches our default Amphora image distribution to
Ubuntu bionic from xenial.
We will now use the existing octavia-v2-dsvm-scenario-ubuntu-xenial
job for testing xenial Amphora images.

Change-Id: I432f81c4e8b01648ff3b96aa63a7b4bb1b3d6e42

commit_message:
Increase the tempest compute build timeout

Prior to the octavia tests starting, the tempest server build call
is timing out booting cirros instances on vexxhost nodepool instances[1].
This patch overrides the tempest defaults for build_timeout from
196 to 300.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/06/649906/1/gate/octavia-v1-dsvm-scenario/ \
    1d11144/job-output.txt.gz#_2019-04-05_00_23_44_381506

Change-Id: I8cf1e43c77b25131d95a0d04d0e772d6abd833fd

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-05 13:23:15.000000000', 'message': "Don't skip creating nova DB user if DB exists

If a user already has the DB for some reason, but not a user for the DB
(at least, not a user that Kolla expects, having a different password or
host for example), the DB user is never created for Nova.

Most other services do not gate the creation of the user and it's
unclear why Nova was. This changes it to be more in-line with other
services, and feels more expected.

Change-Id: I85ca93853613557303aba70024916e1d33e39ea2
"}]
commit_message:
Don't skip creating nova DB user if DB exists

If a user already has the DB for some reason, but not a user for the DB
(at least, not a user that Kolla expects, having a different password or
host for example), the DB user is never created for Nova.

Most other services do not gate the creation of the user and it's
unclear why Nova was. This changes it to be more in-line with other
services, and feels more expected.

Change-Id: I85ca93853613557303aba70024916e1d33e39ea2

Is this ... a thing we're doing?"}, {'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2017-10-09 06:08:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Ah, OK, read the Story and I see the usecase... Though, IMO baremetal for Octavia would be a really odd way to use it, I think. You could use baremetal as a *flavor* for larger workloads, and then have a VM/container flavor for typical smaller workloads, and it wouldn't require muddying the models in this way...
Did we discuss this in a meeting yet? I may have missed it, but if we haven't brought it up, it'd be an interesting topic."}, {'account_id': 26401, 'date': '2017-10-09 08:09:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> Ah, OK, read the Story and I see the usecase... Though, IMO
 > baremetal for Octavia would be a really odd way to use it, I think.
 > You could use baremetal as a *flavor* for larger workloads, and
In my test environment, use 2 physical servers in active-active topo(use ospf publish vip), all lbs is in the 2 servers, it works well.
 > then have a VM/container flavor for typical smaller workloads, and
 > it wouldn't require muddying the models in this way...
Add a configuration parameter to switch between "1 lb 1 amphora" and "mutil lbs 1 amphora", it will not cause much impact.
 > Did we discuss this in a meeting yet? I may have missed it, but if
 > we haven't brought it up, it'd be an interesting topic.
It does not be brought up, but I think it will be useful, and like to finish it, what do you think? should I continue?'}, {'account_id': 26401, 'date': '2017-10-09 08:12:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> Ah, OK, read the Story and I see the usecase... Though, IMO
 > baremetal for Octavia would be a really odd way to use it, I think.
 > You could use baremetal as a *flavor* for larger workloads, and
 > then have a VM/container flavor for typical smaller workloads, and
 > it wouldn't require muddying the models in this way...
 > Did we discuss this in a meeting yet? I may have missed it, but if
 > we haven't brought it up, it'd be an interesting topic.

In my test environment, use 2 physical servers in active-active topo(use ospf publish vip), all lbs is in the 2 servers, it works well.
Add a configuration parameter to switch between "1 lb 1 amphora" and "mutil lbs 1 amphora", it will not cause much impact.
It does not be brought up, but I think it will be useful, and like to finish it, what do you think? should I continue?'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2017-12-18 01:37:13.000000000', 'content': 'Removed reviewer Jenkins with the following votes:

* Verified-1 by Jenkins (3)
'}, {'account_id': 2245, 'date': '2017-12-18 02:12:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

Needs rebase and fix merge conflict'}, {'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2018-06-07 00:46:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-2

Unfortunately I don't know if we would ever be able to accept this change -- the schema change required is totally not backwards compatible. I almost feel like this would require a whole new driver to really do, and the benefits of limiting in scope the amphora driver to "one lb per amphora" in code simplicity make it very attractive. My vote is that we don't move forward with this approach. It would be possible still to write another driver (not the same as the original amp driver) and have a different table and such for it, using whatever schema you want.'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2019-07-18 22:18:36.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

There have been no updates to this patch in over a year. Abandoning it.'}]

I think we shouldn't depend on 'install_package' as suggested, because this functionality is implemented within the devstack repository, and we only git-clone the repo after we already called the installer.

commit_message:
Make new-octavia-devstack.sh OS agnostic

Try to install git using one of: apt, apt-get, dnf, or yum.

Change-Id: Icce72b236b480f498b3a0ecc16252cd200bf5eac

commit_message:
Validate mirrors.yaml and identity.yaml

Before syncing the script will validate the config files and
set juju status to blocked if an error is found. This will
allow juju users understand that the sync is broken due to
a misconfiguration.

Change-Id: Ia7d3e81e23e5f414e18addbbd222078fb289f443
Closes-Bug: #1783125

subject: Remove network_tasks.UpdateVIP task in get_delete_listener_internal_flow
messages:
[{'account_id': 25058, 'date': '2017-12-08 08:28:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2018-01-05 01:21:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

This would cause the listener to not actually be removed on the amphora in the situation where there are multiple listeners.'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2018-01-05 01:23:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Sorry, that comment is incorrect, it means the SG rule allowing the listener port would be left.'}, {'account_id': 25058, 'date': '2018-01-05 01:59:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The DeallocateVIP task in removing the load balancing cascade flow will be delete the security group again,so the SG rule would not be left.'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2019-07-18 22:14:10.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

There have been no updates to this patch in over a year. Abandoning it.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-08 08:28:33.000000000', 'message': 'Remove network_tasks.UpdateVIP task in get_delete_listener_internal_flow

This task is to delete the listener protocol port security group rules,
but delete the load balancing cascade flow DeallocateVIP task will
again delete the security group.

This patch avoids the problem of load balancing failure due to security group

Change-Id: Ia2aa723a9523c4322b98eed6ba4b70ab7f27a029
'}]
commit_message:
Remove network_tasks.UpdateVIP task in get_delete_listener_internal_flow

This task is to delete the listener protocol port security group rules,
but delete the load balancing cascade flow DeallocateVIP task will
again delete the security group.

This patch avoids the problem of load balancing failure due to security group

Change-Id: Ia2aa723a9523c4322b98eed6ba4b70ab7f27a029

Holding as this is not an approved blueprint'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2016-11-28 19:30:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I want to get more information behind the need for this.
Are you sure you want to send stats and not health status?
Why can't other systems use the API to pull this information?"}, {'account_id': 15857, 'date': '2016-11-29 07:01:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Please check my answer in line: 
I want to get more information behind the need for this. 
Are you sure you want to send stats and not health status? 
[xh] based on the pool member details, recover and auto-healing will be triggered. So changes in the update_db.py will send out health message containing the loadbalancer listener stats. Once we reported the bug https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1548774, failure to update db in neutron_lbaas will fail auto-healing loop for unchanged member status.   

Why can't other systems use the API to pull this information? 
[xh] One the one side, problem with polling primary comes from negative impact on performance when the scale increases. On the other side, implements of EventStreamerNeutron need knowledge of RPC call in neutron-lbaas about how to consume this info. But notifier will not need this but depend on listener to process by their own."}, {'account_id': 22998, 'date': '2016-11-29 13:12:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11034, 'date': '2016-11-30 02:31:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi, Michael, thanks a lot for review! About pulling member status through API, I think it could be lower efficient compared with listening to notification. Further more, it might be difficult to decide the interval of status polling: if the interval is too long, the member failure can not be detected promptly; if the interval is too short, the polling could cause big overhead, especially when the system is large scale. I believe all services/tools who depend on lb health status to build their workflow can get benefit from the emitting of this event notification.'}, {'account_id': 10850, 'date': '2016-12-14 16:56:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

I understand your performance concern with polling but since notifications don't have a TTL they will just pile up in the queue if the consumer don't exist can't consume quickly enough - I suggested a switch to disable that functionality. Please also answer the other question in inline comments..."}, {'account_id': 8246, 'date': '2016-12-20 13:38:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thanks for the reviews, guys.

Just want to confirm: should we wait for the BP to be approved before submitting another patch set?'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-06-29 04:06:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified-1

Merge Failed.

This change or one of its cross-repo dependencies was unable to be automatically merged with the current state of its repository. Please rebase the change and upload a new patchset.'}, {'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2017-06-29 17:50:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

I'm not necessarily opposed to this, we just need to fix the bug here."}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2017-12-18 02:57:28.000000000', 'content': 'Removed reviewer Jenkins with the following votes:

* Verified-1 by Jenkins (3)
'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2019-07-18 22:13:09.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

There have been no updates to this patch in two years. Abandoning it.'}]

commit_message:
Extend event_queue with notifier

This patch supports to emit events of lbaas member stats to any
third party listener.

Change-Id: I14e0d88a06ee0b4ef5d0ea58460a5ce414ad9beb
Implements-bp: octavia-event-notifier

safely replace get_transport() with get_rpc_transport() which is much
cleaner.

Change-Id: I2d7db535a4b1734fb5040227a03a9a56dce88d87
'}]
commit_message:
Use get_rpc_transport instead of get_transport

With the added get_rpc_transport() function in oslo.messaging
and the recent version bump of oslo.messaging to 5.24.2, we can
safely replace get_transport() with get_rpc_transport() which is much
cleaner.

Change-Id: I2d7db535a4b1734fb5040227a03a9a56dce88d87

commit_message:
Fix DB update reverts for listener provisioning_status

Now that all objects have a proper provisioning status, update the
revert methods to properly set the provisioning status to error.
Related-Bug: #1624166

Change-Id: Iccc5b8b859ec2ac827ccb5d9bc8e34d79bbd5838

- gate-octavia-v1-dsvm-scenario-kvm-centos.7-ubuntu-xenial-nv http://logs.openstack.org/82/471682/2/check/gate-octavia-v1-dsvm-scenario-kvm-centos.7-ubuntu-xenial-nv/ef100c9/ : SUCCESS in 38m 23s (non-voting)
- gate-octavia-v1-dsvm-scenario-lxd-ubuntu-xenial-nv http://logs.openstack.org/82/471682/2/check/gate-octavia-v1-dsvm-scenario-lxd-ubuntu-xenial-nv/c4e6225/ : FAILURE in 30m 32s (non-voting)'}, {'account_id': 10850, 'date': '2017-06-07 14:32:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I think we need to spend some more time on the design of this feature:
- which log aggregators are supported?  where are they placed? How does that square with our lack of DNS service in the amphora?
- currently the code doesn't deal with encrypted/authenticated transport - how is this supported

I would also like to see some documentation in our operator guide how this feature can be used/configured

Otherwise it's a good start --"}, {'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2017-06-07 17:47:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Yeah, I think we should talk about this, maybe at today's meeting, or next weeks if you can't be there today?

My thought was using syslogd templates to do routing, rather than haproxy directly, so we can fire them off at intervals and not keep so many open connections to one place. As far as distribution, I was imagining using a FIP there and having the FIP pointed to a LB with IP session persistence. :)"}, {'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2017-06-09 00:40:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Yeah I'm -1 on this for the moment just because we need to have some discussion, not necessarily because the code is wrong."}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2019-07-18 22:10:10.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

This is no longer needed as log offloading has replaced this idea.'}]

commit_message:
Remove Sheepdog tests from zuul config

This was not working in Stein either. Backporting to allow us to
eventually remove the job definition in openstack-zuul-jobs.

Change-Id: I4ca37dc248ac5defbc988507379288299b19a6d7
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-18 17:50:56.000000000', 'message': "Add masakari-api to aio_metal

Since masakari-api wasn't placed inside aio_metal.yml, during CI
container for api is created and service is runned inside container,
but on on metal as supposed. This patch fixes such behavior and place
masakari api on metal.

Change-Id: I58ae75e550250bfcd2838e2a424d6a479d490a63
(cherry picked from commit 91fe1065eb6f8beb093177f1977879750c178602)
"}]
commit_message:
Add masakari-api to aio_metal

Since masakari-api wasn't placed inside aio_metal.yml, during CI
container for api is created and service is runned inside container,
but on on metal as supposed. This patch fixes such behavior and place
masakari api on metal.

Change-Id: I58ae75e550250bfcd2838e2a424d6a479d490a63
(cherry picked from commit 91fe1065eb6f8beb093177f1977879750c178602)

commit_message:
Pass to parted parameters based on fs type.

Even if the partiton type was specified as something different from ext4 parted
was passed ext4 parameters.

Change-Id: Ia2905d0b1acacc07ab2fb0363a4d45bff0a93f4e

[{'created': '2019-06-20 22:04:57.000000000', 'message': 'Add Apache/uWSGI configuration examples

This change[1] allowed Qinling API to be used with Apache mod_wsgi and uWSGI.

Using Apache/uWSGI is the best approach for a production environment,
Apache virtualhost and uWSGI examples are available into
etc/{apache2|uwsgi} directory.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/661851/

commit_message:
Add Apache/uWSGI configuration examples

This change[1] allowed Qinling API to be used with Apache mod_wsgi and uWSGI.

Using Apache/uWSGI is the best approach for a production environment,
Apache virtualhost and uWSGI examples are available into
etc/{apache2|uwsgi} directory.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/661851/

Change-Id: I052ff1a674529539db82947150b32ed564e939f8
Story: 2005920
Task: 34194

commit_message:
setup: don't try to login to create users and upgrade

We delegate to a setup host which already has things wired up
for setting things up which contains a .my.cnf file that works
just fine with all credentials to connect.

subject: Convert dynamic includes to static imports
messages: [{'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2019-07-17 17:03:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2019-07-18 12:38:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2019-07-18 12:52:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2019-07-18 16:59:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-17 17:03:37.000000000', 'message': 'Convert dynamic includes to static imports

When task/role files are included using include_tasks, tags are not
passed to the included tasks. As a result, tags like trove-config
do not have the intended effect. This patch changes include_tasks
to import_tasks for all cases where dynamic vars or loops are not used
so that tags are properly handled.

Reference -
https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/user_guide/playbooks_reuse.html
https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-ansible/+bug/1815043

Change-Id: I754049a0e37daadddf1fa52a3b651284ee02b27e
'}]
commit_message:
Convert dynamic includes to static imports

When task/role files are included using include_tasks, tags are not
passed to the included tasks. As a result, tags like trove-config
do not have the intended effect. This patch changes include_tasks
to import_tasks for all cases where dynamic vars or loops are not used
so that tags are properly handled.

Reference -
https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/user_guide/playbooks_reuse.html
https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-ansible/+bug/1815043

Change-Id: I754049a0e37daadddf1fa52a3b651284ee02b27e

commit_message:
Use systemd-journald instead of log files

This patch aims to migrate service from usage of regular syslog files
to journald. We also disable uwsgi logging, since it dublicates
requests that are logged by service itself.

Change-Id: I0f9eeeb5db890ba2119f7e8a5e85b9f6923092d6

[{'created': '2019-07-18 10:04:57.000000000', 'message': 'Convert systemd services to common role(s)

This removes the systemd service templates and tasks from this role and
leverages a common systemd service role instead. This change removes a
lot of code duplication across all roles all without sacrificing
features or functionality. The intention of this change is to ensure
uniformity and reduce the maintenance burden on the community when
sweeping changes are needed. The exterior role is built to be OSA

commit_message:
Convert systemd services to common role(s)

This removes the systemd service templates and tasks from this role and
leverages a common systemd service role instead. This change removes a
lot of code duplication across all roles all without sacrificing
features or functionality. The intention of this change is to ensure
uniformity and reduce the maintenance burden on the community when
sweeping changes are needed. The exterior role is built to be OSA
compatible and may be pulled into tree should we deem it necessary.

Change-Id: If8a201dd964ea769c688f78abc2a688782e3be4d

subject: Fix leader fail-over for cert provider
messages:
[{'account_id': 20635, 'date': '2019-07-18 18:02:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 20635, 'date': '2019-07-18 18:02:56.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from bug/1836348-stable/19.04 to bug/1836348'}, {'account_id': 20635, 'date': '2019-07-18 19:24:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

charm-recheck-full'}, {'account_id': 20805, 'date': '2019-07-18 20:34:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Merging.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-18 18:02:39.000000000', 'message': "Fix leader fail-over for cert provider

When leadership is transferred to another unit when Vault is in HA mode,
the new leader didn't have the `charm.vault.ca.ready` flag set, so it
would fail to respond to any cert requests, even though the CA was
already properly configured. This addresses that issue, with the caveat
that when the leadership takeover happens, all requested certs will be
re-issued due to the new leader (potentially) not having access to the
previously published data.  (We can fix this once we have
application-level relation data.)

Fixes lp:1836348

Change-Id: Ifd8bfbf0a5c44f1e70ff7ad999dfda7333014a88
(cherry picked from commit 833a5e83a16e1c0d92b252d306a7f35799fe24b5)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix leader fail-over for cert provider

When leadership is transferred to another unit when Vault is in HA mode,
the new leader didn't have the `charm.vault.ca.ready` flag set, so it
would fail to respond to any cert requests, even though the CA was
already properly configured. This addresses that issue, with the caveat
that when the leadership takeover happens, all requested certs will be
re-issued due to the new leader (potentially) not having access to the
previously published data.  (We can fix this once we have
application-level relation data.)

Fixes lp:1836348

Change-Id: Ifd8bfbf0a5c44f1e70ff7ad999dfda7333014a88
(cherry picked from commit 833a5e83a16e1c0d92b252d306a7f35799fe24b5)

commit_message:
Install the pyc as well for the filelist capturing it

The change in Ib03f38285c3de377d4c71de4ed7feb1bfa919a35 was actually
incomplete, it updated the filelist but never actually instaled
the additional files, so they were not included.

Change-Id: Ibb3cbfc6c940ba5a436fcb13e8d9200e647acc78

[{'created': '2019-07-15 15:29:59.000000000', 'message': "Always add NAT rule to a LR when updating a FIP

Before this patch, the NAT rule was attempted to be updated when a
FIP was reassigned to another port. However, this was a noop
since the NAT rule didn't exist anymore causing the reassigning to
be ineffective and to fail silently.

This patch is always adding the NAT rule to the Logical Router
no matter if the Neutron FIP is being added or updated.

The bug that this patch addresses was being hit in the gate with
around a 30% ratio because the maintenance task was fixing it while
tempest was still rying to SSH into it.

commit_message:
Always add NAT rule to a LR when updating a FIP

Before this patch, the NAT rule was attempted to be updated when a
FIP was reassigned to another port. However, this was a noop
since the NAT rule didn't exist anymore causing the reassigning to
be ineffective and to fail silently.

This patch is always adding the NAT rule to the Logical Router
no matter if the Neutron FIP is being added or updated.

The bug that this patch addresses was being hit in the gate with
around a 30% ratio because the maintenance task was fixing it while
tempest was still rying to SSH into it.

Change-Id: Icebf4a82f64989112c3ca810b4358de490108c2d
Closes-Bug: #1835029
Closes-Bug: #1833820
Co-Authored-By: Jakub Libosvar <jlibosva@redhat.com>
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Use the dynamic aio scenario

Rather than have to define a job per non-aio service, we have
zuul introspect the origin test repo and add the service name
to the scenario variable on the fly. This allows us to simplify
our job definitions and simply use the AIO job template for all
repositories.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/658398
Change-Id: I0010fd81bbc1f99f1f792648b0f2a514aea14cce

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-11 00:12:47.000000000', 'message': "test-requirements.txt: rm requests to fix tox

`tox -e pep8` will fail since `charm-tools` requires
older `requests` version.

In `charm-keystone/test-requirements.txt`:

     charm-tools>=2.4.4
     requests>=2.18.4

In `charm-tools/requirements.txt`:

     requests<=2.20.1

When we run `tox -e pep8` in `charm-keystone`, top level
requirement `requests>=2.18.4` was used, and latest
requests(2.22.0) was installed.

When `tox` called `charm-tools`, it failed since `requests` is too new:

    pkg_resources.ContextualVersionConflict:
    (requests 2.22.0 (charm-keystone/.tox/pep8/lib/python3.6/site-packages),
    Requirement.parse('requests<=2.20.1'), {'charm-tools'})

This patch remove `requests>=2.18.4` in `test-requirements.txt`,
and let `charm-tools` decide the version.

A separate patch could be created to update `requests` version in `charm-tools`.

Change-Id: I0aee5545f094f165cfe5b493166bbcda879958e4
Closes-Bug: #1836119
Signed-off-by: Joe Guo <guoqiao@gmail.com>
"}]
commit_message:
test-requirements.txt: rm requests to fix tox

`tox -e pep8` will fail since `charm-tools` requires
older `requests` version.

In `charm-keystone/test-requirements.txt`:

     charm-tools>=2.4.4
     requests>=2.18.4

In `charm-tools/requirements.txt`:

     requests<=2.20.1

When we run `tox -e pep8` in `charm-keystone`, top level
requirement `requests>=2.18.4` was used, and latest
requests(2.22.0) was installed.

When `tox` called `charm-tools`, it failed since `requests` is too new:

    pkg_resources.ContextualVersionConflict:
    (requests 2.22.0 (charm-keystone/.tox/pep8/lib/python3.6/site-packages),
    Requirement.parse('requests<=2.20.1'), {'charm-tools'})

This patch remove `requests>=2.18.4` in `test-requirements.txt`,
and let `charm-tools` decide the version.

A separate patch could be created to update `requests` version in `charm-tools`.

Change-Id: I0aee5545f094f165cfe5b493166bbcda879958e4
Closes-Bug: #1836119
Signed-off-by: Joe Guo <guoqiao@gmail.com>

commit_message:
setup: don't try to login to create users and upgrade

We delegate to a setup host which already has things wired up
for setting things up which contains a .my.cnf file that works
just fine with all credentials to connect.

Change-Id: Ife23cf46ab06a81776f3e8653a40bd4bbf745b50

commit_message:
Use systemd-journald instead of log files

This patch aims to migrate service from usage of regular syslog files
to journald. We also disable uwsgi logging, since it dublicates
requests that are logged by service itself.

Change-Id: I61605b7820bb518fb809b01781f6d83f89487be8

commit_message:
Set nodepool mirror PIP_OPTS consistently

The bootstrap-ansible script does not always run as a child of the
gate-check-commit, so bootstrap-ansible should be prepared to load
the nodepool PIP mirrors itself. Move the nodepool mirror detection
into a common function so it can be used in both bootstrap-ansible
and gate-check-commit.

Change-Id: Ie5c8d65aee11d6dba18a0388467783cc6e9e5d36
(cherry picked from commit bd36689c2ce122ffd35b74187bd4b9feb5fde5d6)

commit_message:
Helm-Toolkit: Add a function to return quoted csv sting from a list

Added a utility function of return joint list with single quotes and
separated with comma.

commit_message:
Use systemd-journald instead of log files

This patch aims to migrate service from usage of regular syslog files
to journald. We also disable uwsgi logging, since it dublicates
requests that are logged by service itself.

Change-Id: Id68c80b52fe72bd209e96dba230b4f2cb12f900d

'}, {'created': '2019-02-25 08:26:46.000000000', 'message': 'Add validation of app cred access rules

This commit adds a validation step in the auth_token middleware to check
for the presence of an access_rules attribute in an application
credential token and to validate the request against the permissions
granted for that token. During token validation it sends a header to
keystone to indicate that it is capable of validating these access
rules, and not providing this header for a token like this would result
in the token failing validation. Currently this disregards access rules
for a service request made by a service on behalf of a user, such as
nova making a request to glance, but this is likely to change in the
future.

bp whitelist-extension-for-app-creds

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/636030
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/636786

Change-Id: I185e0541d5df538d74edadf9976b3034a2470c88
'}, {'created': '2019-02-28 19:49:46.000000000', 'message': 'Add validation of app cred access rules

This commit adds a validation step in the auth_token middleware to check
for the presence of an access_rules attribute in an application
credential token and to validate the request against the permissions
granted for that token. During token validation it sends a header to
keystone to indicate that it is capable of validating these access
rules, and not providing this header for a token like this would result
in the token failing validation. Currently this disregards access rules
for a service request made by a service on behalf of a user, such as
nova making a request to glance, but this is likely to change in the
future.

commit_message:
Add validation of app cred access rules

This commit adds a validation step in the auth_token middleware to check
for the presence of an access_rules attribute in an application
credential token and to validate the request against the permissions
granted for that token. During token validation it sends a header to
keystone to indicate that it is capable of validating these access
rules, and not providing this header for a token like this would result
in the token failing validation. This disregards access rules for a
service request made by a service on behalf of a user, such as nova
making a request to glance, because such a request is not under the
control of the user and is not expected to be explicitly allowed in the
access rules.

bp whitelist-extension-for-app-creds

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/670377

Change-Id: I185e0541d5df538d74edadf9976b3034a2470c88

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-18 09:49:10.000000000', 'message': 'Convert dynamic includes to static imports

When task/role files are included using include_tasks, tags are not
passed to the included tasks. As a result, tags like sahara-config
do not have the intended effect. This patch changes include_tasks
to import_tasks for all cases where dynamic vars or loops are not used
so that tags are properly handled.

Reference -
https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/user_guide/playbooks_reuse.html
https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-ansible/+bug/1815043

Change-Id: I74bda8876e0f043cd7362ab04fcdb74d24d35d72
'}]
commit_message:
Convert dynamic includes to static imports

When task/role files are included using include_tasks, tags are not
passed to the included tasks. As a result, tags like sahara-config
do not have the intended effect. This patch changes include_tasks
to import_tasks for all cases where dynamic vars or loops are not used
so that tags are properly handled.

Reference -
https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/user_guide/playbooks_reuse.html
https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-ansible/+bug/1815043

Change-Id: I74bda8876e0f043cd7362ab04fcdb74d24d35d72

[{'created': '2019-07-14 10:26:35.000000000', 'message': 'Remove tempest-full jobs from Neutron CI

In commit [1] neutron replaced using "integrated-gate" template, which
provides tempest-full job with new "integrated-gate-networking" tempate,
which provides "tempest-integrated-networking" job to run only tests related
to Neutron and Nova in Neutron CI.
Unfortunatelly tempest-full and tempest-full-py3 jobs were also
configured in Neutron's zuul file separately so we ended up with running
all 3 of those jobs in our check and gate queue.

So this patch removed "tempest-full" and "tempest-full-py3" jobs from
Neutron's check and gate queue and left only new
"tempest-integrated-networking" job to be run there.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/669815/

Change-Id: Ia74454c0986d0ef24b9a42ab1e2e0f296511cd3f

commit_message:
Remove tempest-full jobs from Neutron CI

In commit [1] neutron replaced using "integrated-gate" template, which
provides tempest-full job with new "integrated-gate-networking" tempate,
which provides "tempest-integrated-networking" job to run only tests related
to Neutron and Nova in Neutron CI.
Unfortunatelly tempest-full and tempest-full-py3 jobs were also
configured in Neutron's zuul file separately so we ended up with running
all 3 of those jobs in our check and gate queue.

So this patch removed "tempest-full" and "tempest-full-py3" jobs from
Neutron's check and gate queue and left only new
"tempest-integrated-networking" job to be run there.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/669815/

Change-Id: Ia74454c0986d0ef24b9a42ab1e2e0f296511cd3f

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-05 09:00:49.000000000', 'message': "Define the Integrated-gate-object-storage gate template

tempest-full job run all services API and scenario tests (non slow)
and this job is part of Integrated-gate gate template which run on
multiple services (nova, neutron, cinder, glance, placement) check
and gate pipeline.

But there are many unrelated tests run on each project gate. For example,
neutron gate run cinder only tests and fail due to cinder bugs. There is
no point of breaking the neutron gate due to cinder only test failure and
slow down the neutron development phase.

This is what we dicussed in Train PTG in denver to improve the integrated
gate[1] and came up with idea of split the integated-gate template into
much logical way so that only dependent services tests run on their gate.

One way was to move the service only tests to service tempest plugin side
but Tempest is used by interop as well as on production cloud testing so
moving the test is not good idea.

This commit propose the idea of defining the 'Integrated-gate-object-storage'
gate template for swift gate which will run only Swift, Cinder and glance tests.

ML discussion: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-May/005871.html

Next step will be to replace the Integrated-gate-py3 template with new
Integrated-gate-object-storage template on swift gate.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/qa-train-ptg

Change-Id: I70851d41174462b83cc8c525cecdb1b3d65e4ec7

commit_message:
Define the Integrated-gate-object-storage gate template

tempest-full job run all services API and scenario tests (non slow)
and this job is part of Integrated-gate gate template which run on
multiple services (nova, neutron, cinder, glance, placement) check
and gate pipeline.

But there are many unrelated tests run on each project gate. For example,
neutron gate run cinder only tests and fail due to cinder bugs. There is
no point of breaking the neutron gate due to cinder only test failure and
slow down the neutron development phase.

This is what we dicussed in Train PTG in denver to improve the integrated
gate[1] and came up with idea of split the integated-gate template into
much logical way so that only dependent services tests run on their gate.

One way was to move the service only tests to service tempest plugin side
but Tempest is used by interop as well as on production cloud testing so
moving the test is not good idea.

This commit propose the idea of defining the 'Integrated-gate-object-storage'
gate template for swift gate which will run only Swift, Cinder and glance tests.

ML discussion: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-May/005871.html

Next step will be to replace the Integrated-gate-py3 template with new
Integrated-gate-object-storage template on swift gate.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/qa-train-ptg

Change-Id: I70851d41174462b83cc8c525cecdb1b3d65e4ec7

RabbitMQ: prune any extra nodes from cluster if scaling down

This PS updates the cluster wait job to prune any extra nodes from
the cluster if scaling down.

Change-Id: I58d22121a07cd99448add62502582a6873776622
Signed-off-by: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>

I like your idea of an extra object server (you mentioned in IRC). if extra nodes aren't really an issue. Ideally, 2x proxy, 2x AC and 2x O would been nice. Then we can "test" zero downtime time upgrade as well. But that would mean 2 more VMs so something we could decide later.

Add a new set of "rolling" tests. Their intent is to test basic
CRUD functionality during a rolling upgrade. The sequence would
be something like this:
 1. Install "old" version of Swift
 2. Run "rolling_before" tests. These tests will leave data on cluster
 3. Upgrade Swift
 4. Run "rolling_after" tests. These tests reads the "before" data

It was necessary to add a new test runner VM. The functional test runner
is running the functional tests from the old version of swift.
The new test runner, needs to have the latest code (master).

commit_message:
Add rolling upgrade tests

Add a new set of "rolling" tests. Their intent is to test basic
CRUD functionality during a rolling upgrade. The sequence would
be something like this:
 1. Install "old" version of Swift
 2. Run "rolling/stage" tests. These tests will leave data on cluster
 3. Upgrade Swift
 4. Run "rolling/verify" tests. These tests reads the "stage" data

It was necessary to add a new test runner VM. The functional test runner
is running the functional tests from the old version of swift.
The new test runner, needs to have the latest code (master).

Change-Id: Ie0e0b30ba7c51f7881126456ac6b6e90a4b4010c

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-18 18:46:28.000000000', 'message': 'Replace "integrated-gate-py3" template with new "integrated-gate-placement"

tempest-full-py3 job run all services API and scenario tests (non slow)
and this job is part of Integrated-gate-py3 gate template which run on
multiple services (nova, neutron, cinder, glance, placement, swift, keystone)
check and gate pipeline.
Due to all services tests run in single tempest-full-py3 job, it has
been not so stable. Many times unrelated service test break other
project gate.

But not all those services are dependent of placement. Dependent in term of
both way, not all services used by placement or use placement. Placement gate
does not need to run all those independent services tests. It can run only
nova and neutron tests. If any other project use placement in future then
we can update the template.

Idea here is to make integrated-gate testing more stable without losing
the test coverage.

Tempest has new "integrated-gate-placement" template which will run only
nova and neutron tests[1].

This commit replaces the "integrated-gate-py3" template with new
"integrated-gate-placement".

ML discussion: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-May/005871.html

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/src/branch/master/.zuul.yaml#L610

Change-Id: I043003df69d74e9a709ef7e441b2564949376a2e
'}]
commit_message:
Replace "integrated-gate-py3" template with new "integrated-gate-placement"

tempest-full-py3 job run all services API and scenario tests (non slow)
and this job is part of Integrated-gate-py3 gate template which run on
multiple services (nova, neutron, cinder, glance, placement, swift, keystone)
check and gate pipeline.
Due to all services tests run in single tempest-full-py3 job, it has
been not so stable. Many times unrelated service test break other
project gate.

But not all those services are dependent of placement. Dependent in term of
both way, not all services used by placement or use placement. Placement gate
does not need to run all those independent services tests. It can run only
nova and neutron tests. If any other project use placement in future then
we can update the template.

Idea here is to make integrated-gate testing more stable without losing
the test coverage.

Tempest has new "integrated-gate-placement" template which will run only
nova and neutron tests[1].

This commit replaces the "integrated-gate-py3" template with new
"integrated-gate-placement".

ML discussion: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-May/005871.html

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/src/branch/master/.zuul.yaml#L610

Change-Id: I043003df69d74e9a709ef7e441b2564949376a2e

os-resource-classes 0.5.0 was recently released and upper
constraints were bumped. We have decided to always pin placement

Change-Id: Idd4920885b10f0b21b2b67d9526f1048b06f7db5

commit_message:
Bump os-resource-classes requirements

os-resource-classes 0.5.0 was recently released and upper
constraints were bumped. We have decided to always pin placement
to the latest versions of os-resource-classes and os-traits.
This patch makes it so, again.

Change-Id: Idd4920885b10f0b21b2b67d9526f1048b06f7db5

Add TripleO container based job to Neutron's check queue

This patch adds non-voting tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario007-standalone
job which will use TripleO to deploy Neutron in containers.
