revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-12 21:23:28.000000000', 'message': "Fix leader fail-over for cert provider

When leadership is transferred to another unit when Vault is in HA mode,
the new leader didn't have the `charm.vault.ca.ready` flag set, so it
would fail to respond to any cert requests, even though the CA was
already properly configured. This addresses that issue, with the caveat
that when the leadership takeover happens, all requested certs will be
re-issued due to the new leader (potentially) not having access to the
previously published data.  (We can fix this once we have
application-level relation data.)

Fixes lp:1836348

Change-Id: Ifd8bfbf0a5c44f1e70ff7ad999dfda7333014a88
"}]
commit_message:
Fix leader fail-over for cert provider

When leadership is transferred to another unit when Vault is in HA mode,
the new leader didn't have the `charm.vault.ca.ready` flag set, so it
would fail to respond to any cert requests, even though the CA was
already properly configured. This addresses that issue, with the caveat
that when the leadership takeover happens, all requested certs will be
re-issued due to the new leader (potentially) not having access to the
previously published data.  (We can fix this once we have
application-level relation data.)

Fixes lp:1836348

Change-Id: Ifd8bfbf0a5c44f1e70ff7ad999dfda7333014a88

commit_message:
Add masakari-api to aio_metal

Since masakari-api wasn't placed inside aio_metal.yml, during CI
container for api is created and service is runned inside container,
but on on metal as supposed. This patch fixes such behavior and place
masakari api on metal.

Change-Id: I58ae75e550250bfcd2838e2a424d6a479d490a63

commit_message:
Replace joinedload_all with joinedload

Replace sqlalchemy.orm.joinedload_all with
sqlalchemy.orm.joinedload called within a
new method _joinedload_all that makes multiple
calls to orm.joinedload.

'joinedload_all' has been deprecated since
sqlalchemy version 0.9.0, and now makes a
lot of warning noises.

Change-Id: I7a30efa8ceb21e02e71d8c15bf979bb66470ef91
Closes-Bug: #1832164

commit_message:
Add tripleo standalone job

Since ansible-config_template project is using in TripleO and
any change in this project will break the TripleO. It would be
good have a job which tests both the projects and make sure
it does not break anything.

Change-Id: Ia85e497beb13c115c3b1ee8deaa624cab2f1aa8e
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Manage oslo_middleware/max_request_body_size

So that we can increase it from the default 114688

Useful in case for example the OS-Federation mapping is too large.

If this limit is breached keystone will return a 413 Entity Too Large
and not log anything to keystone.log.

Closes-Bug: #1835161

Change-Id: If9fc5c0bb5d6216b8656ee1673e1812c543de305
Signed-off-by: Johan Guldmyr <johan.guldmyr@csc.fi>
(cherry picked from commit a60980f3da715b5d4ac986ae515e5aed88b35b74)

messages: [{'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2019-07-16 19:41:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2019-07-16 20:51:23.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from fix-legacy to documentation-update'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2019-07-16 20:51:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2019-07-16 21:57:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nNote that another solution would have been to include the former refstack team deliverables in the legacy.yaml, since as it stands their contributors are no longer able to vote in TC elections.'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2019-07-17 13:43:40.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from documentation-update to documentation-change'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-07-18 02:24:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 10607, 'date': '2019-07-18 13:50:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2019-07-18 14:40:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2019-07-18 16:55:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2019-07-18 17:01:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-16 19:41:43.000000000', 'message': 'Add empty deliverables list to (retired) refstack

When the Refstack team was retired, its only deliverable repos were
adopted by the Interop working group of the OSF board of directors
and so no deliverables were added to the legacy.yaml set. Insert an
empty deliverables list to be explicit about it, since election
tooling expects every team in this file to have a list of
deliverables and altering the tooling to ignore a missing
deliverables key makes us fragile in the face of errors of omission.
Explicit rather than implicit.

Change-Id: I6f8fc02cb1d280749691c28d8004af9b628f9ed3
'}]
commit_message:
Add empty deliverables list to (retired) refstack

When the Refstack team was retired, its only deliverable repos were
adopted by the Interop working group of the OSF board of directors
and so no deliverables were added to the legacy.yaml set. Insert an
empty deliverables list to be explicit about it, since election
tooling expects every team in this file to have a list of
deliverables and altering the tooling to ignore a missing
deliverables key makes us fragile in the face of errors of omission.
Explicit rather than implicit.

Change-Id: I6f8fc02cb1d280749691c28d8004af9b628f9ed3

commit_message:
deploy-steps: remove unused hieradata_templates_list

hieradata_templates_list is not used anymore, we are merging the hiera
files.
Also removing the old hiera data files, not needed anymore.

commit_message:
tripleo-hieradata: refactor j2 hiera templates

Simplify the Hieradata files structure by merging and separating into 3
files:

- global_vars.json for Hieradata applied everywhere.
- group_vars.json for Hieradata applied per-role.
- host_vars.json for Hieradata applied per-node.

Also removes hieradata_templates_list variable, not useful anymore.

Change-Id: I5fa58f91bab1bc7fe5e4b80d037730b75d69b445

tripleo-hieradata: include config_step into all_nodes_merged

... so we don't need a dedicated hieradata file for the config_step.

[{'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2019-07-09 04:59:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14495, 'date': '2019-07-09 07:31:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2019-07-10 01:56:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(33 comments)

Thank you for writing this!

I think the biggest gap in this documentation is a high-level explanation of the difference between the client certificate and the issuer. A short breakdown of those terms and how the different pieces might be generated, followed by explicitly different names for each in the rest of the examples, would be helpful.

The bug report mentions adding information to the user guide, but if this is only intended for keystone_authtoken configuration then I think it's safe to ignore that."}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2019-07-11 00:37:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(32 comments)'}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2019-07-11 00:38:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2019-07-11 21:16:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2019-07-11 22:40:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(7 comments)

Looks really good, a couple more minor issues still.

I'm fairly sure in general federated auth requires using a specific protocol that has an entrypoint in setuptools and is listed in the auth methods. In that case you also have to hit a specific auth API with the protocol as part of the path, so I guess that may be the difference here and why the protocol name isn't restricted in this case?"}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2019-07-11 23:37:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> (7 comments)
 > 
 > Looks really good, a couple more minor issues still.
 > 
 > I'm fairly sure in general federated auth requires using a specific
 > protocol that has an entrypoint in setuptools and is listed in the
 > auth methods. In that case you also have to hit a specific auth API
 > with the protocol as part of the path, so I guess that may be the
 > difference here and why the protocol name isn't restricted in this
 > case?

Thanks Colleen. Protocol can be arbitrary, and it must match the one in the protocol-IDP pairing. I just tested this in my dev env by setting 'protocol = foo' and it worked fine."}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2019-07-11 23:44:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2019-07-11 23:45:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2019-07-12 00:28:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2019-07-15 19:44:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Dropping the py35 testing

All the integration testing has been moved to
Bionic now[1] and py3.5 is not tested runtime for
Train or stable/stein[2].

As per below ML thread, we are good to drop the py35
testing now:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/005097.html

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/004647.html
[2]
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/train.html

Change-Id: I90ce9c84121c78398928cb4dab1901d46ead3692

'}, {'created': '2019-07-18 10:11:58.000000000', 'message': "Run multinode jobs on all patches

With current config the multinode job runs only on changes of
requirements.txt file. Remove it here because it's included in
project template that allows to run on all other patches.
Change-Id: Id2408eaf9bf1da5c73859221daca053a30486f8c
"}]
commit_message:
Run multinode jobs on all patches

With current config the multinode job runs only on changes of
requirements.txt file. Remove it here because it's included in
project template that allows to run on all other patches.
Change-Id: Id2408eaf9bf1da5c73859221daca053a30486f8c

commit_message:
Add facter cache for container configurations

Rather than running all the facts for every invocation of
container-puppet.py, let's cache the facts for the entire container
config step.  This is similar to what used to happen when we ran puppet
in a single instance for a given step. This improves the time it takes
puppet tp execute within the containers. When systems have large number
of interfaces, the fact generation for puppet can come to a crawl given
that puppet is not supposed to be invoked multiple times in parallel. By
pre-caching the facts, we eliminate the need for puppet to do the
network (and other fact) related lookups when running container
configuration generation.

Closes-Bug: #1835959
Change-Id: I6ee3849ff380304a184638493f33882b813bfdff

commit_message:
MetricsQdr: Build sslProfiles without internal TLS

sslProfiles submitted as a parameter are not created when internal_tls
is not true. This change adds the ability also create ad-hoc
sslProfiles when internal TLS is not used.

Change-Id: I07b79c398ea900f388e75d25eddd8853abb9e5fb
(cherry picked from commit ae439aa39b7fbe724a87c402b11799e754bccdb9)
(cherry picked from commit c7da8495e6dc22da7a36b9061d1d375eaca45430)

commit_message:
Add local bindep.txt and limit bandit version

As it was announced [1] global bindep-fallback.txt was removed and now
projects need to have a local bindep.txt to be able to install binary
dependencies for testing.

In test jobs the script tools/test-setup.sh is called which requires
mysql and postgres servers and clients to be installed.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-June/007272.html

(cherry picked from commit d116b216965bbfc80840f5bfc994b731e2d29d81)

Note(elod.illes): patch was modified so that the test-requires files
are kept. An upper constraint was also added for bandit. This actually
freezes requirements (required by bandit) on stable branch.

Change-Id: If9befe4115c64c2fda52321002ba5fe1124eaf7c
(cherry picked from commit 916fd05627dddce33a577038f983e17295cc44e8)

[{'created': '2019-07-17 09:51:56.000000000', 'message': "Expose 'mem_stats_period_seconds' config parameter

Add support for configuring 'mem_stats_period_seconds'
libvirt config option.

When using the balloon stats in the XML configuration, user gets
latency violation in guests, because balloon stats causes QEMU to
periodically send asynchronous requests to balloon driver in the guest.

Change-Id: If69d32fb4b718b97efbfbe0d58a37966af957be9
(cherry picked from commit 05d7733e2a754fb45b0fb76b784b44339e78745c)
"}]
commit_message:
Expose 'mem_stats_period_seconds' config parameter

Add support for configuring 'mem_stats_period_seconds'
libvirt config option.

When using the balloon stats in the XML configuration, user gets
latency violation in guests, because balloon stats causes QEMU to
periodically send asynchronous requests to balloon driver in the guest.

Change-Id: If69d32fb4b718b97efbfbe0d58a37966af957be9
(cherry picked from commit 05d7733e2a754fb45b0fb76b784b44339e78745c)

commit_message:
Add Python 3 Train unit tests

This is a mechanically generated patch to ensure unit testing is in place
for all of the Tested Runtimes for Train.

See the Train python3-updates goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/python3-updates.html

Change-Id: Iecd3efedfbe42eaeabce7e4f51a05c7ba5c3ea15
Story: #2005924
Task: #34200

commit_message:
Be specific about regions in the 'U' release name poll

The language in the table is a little cumbersome.

Use `China` to include all regions, cities, or provinces

Change-Id: Ic1c951a6a6977efd0ed394d15d4788f49e477751

commit_message:
Rsyslog image pull

This patch enables assignment of rsyslog container image
to rsyslog composable service and unifies sidecar service
to use the full featured image instead

[{'created': '2019-07-18 07:35:40.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Move tripleo-ci-centos-7-containers-multinode to os_tempest"

containers-multinode job is broken in stable releases as
they do not support os_tempest yet. The logic to enable
os_tempest can go in featureset file instead of tweaking the
job.

This reverts commit 64b6b42f075ba5f135c9c2050d65b8e2a91b7c97.

Change-Id: I7e5f7f9716b289e84feeabb387f7ae94c33c1492
'}, {'created': '2019-07-18 08:51:56.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Move tripleo-ci-centos-7-containers-multinode to os_tempest"

containers-multinode job is broken in stable releases as
they do not support os_tempest yet. The logic to enable
os_tempest can go in featureset file instead of tweaking the
job.

This reverts commit 64b6b42f075ba5f135c9c2050d65b8e2a91b7c97.
Closes-Bug: 1837019
Change-Id: I7e5f7f9716b289e84feeabb387f7ae94c33c1492
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Move tripleo-ci-centos-7-containers-multinode to os_tempest"

containers-multinode job is broken in stable releases as
they do not support os_tempest yet. The logic to enable
os_tempest can go in featureset file instead of tweaking the
job.

This reverts commit 64b6b42f075ba5f135c9c2050d65b8e2a91b7c97.
Closes-Bug: 1837019

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I158a8368f1e2fd4df14753e69141111b451443be
Closes-Bug:  #1801657

Add Python 3 Train unit tests

This is a mechanically generated patch to ensure unit testing is in place
for all of the Tested Runtimes for Train.

See the Train python3-updates goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/python3-updates.html

commit_message:
Mention the new cycle-automatic release model

The release team introduced a new release model in the Train
cycle called cycle-automatic, to simplify handling of deliverables
like Tempest plugins. This should be reflected here.

Change-Id: I4d86fe93f9701d9665c762630ae38881a119f721
Task: 34188
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/666546

commit_message:
Use systemd-journald instead of log files

This patch aims to migrate service from usage of regular syslog files
to journald. We also disable uwsgi logging, since it dublicates
requests that are logged by service itself.

Change-Id: Id466ac20d9d18fa86a4615a73433a51720bafc8e

[{'account_id': 27822, 'date': '2019-06-19 04:23:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2019-06-19 20:05:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Thanks for the change, reading through the email http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-May/006478.html, it appears that we need more changes. 

For example "Make sure projects do not specify a constraint file in install_command" isn't covered in your change.'}, {'account_id': 27822, 'date': '2019-06-21 01:27:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Thanks for the change, reading through the email http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-May/006478.html,
 > it appears that we need more changes.
 > 
 > For example "Make sure projects do not specify a constraint file in
 > install_command" isn't covered in your change.

This feature already exists in L102-L107 and does not need to be added'}, {'account_id': 27822, 'date': '2019-07-01 03:44:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2019-07-01 10:12:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Lines 102-107 ensure that the lower-constraints file is specified as a dep but not the upper constraints file, which is still specified in the install command for the testenv.  IIUC the email cited says this will cause the lower-constraints file to be ignored in the lower-constraints testenv in favor of the upper-constraints file and that the way to avoid this is to move the upper-constraints out of that command line to the deps for the testenv itself.'}, {'account_id': 27822, 'date': '2019-07-02 02:04:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 27822, 'date': '2019-07-02 02:56:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 27822, 'date': '2019-07-02 03:09:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2019-07-02 11:09:14.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from Bug#3 to constraints'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2019-07-02 11:10:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

I set the Topic on this and the related review to "constraints" so that they are grouped together and not with arbitrary other reviews.'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2019-07-02 11:28:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2

This looks right to me now.'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2019-07-18 13:26:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Workflow+1'}]

[{'account_id': 27822, 'date': '2019-06-26 08:53:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 27822, 'date': '2019-06-27 01:27:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2019-07-02 11:01:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

The proposed change looks good to me, but going forwards please use more descriptive Topic labels.  These group related reviews and it is quite confusing to see lots of unrelated reviews all labeled Bug#1.

Also, it is useful to have "TrivialFix" in the commit message when a launchpad bug is not filed (and I agree none is necessary for this review).

Please see: https://docs.openstack.org/manila/latest/contributor/commit_message_tags.html'}, {'account_id': 27822, 'date': '2019-07-03 01:26:43.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from Bug#1 to remove_get_item_method'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2019-07-18 13:25:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Remove the get_item method

The method of get_item is not used, IMO, we should remove it

commit_message:
Parse function alias when job is running

When creating jobs using function alias, the job should pick up the
correct function(version) when it's running.

Story: #2005921
Task: #34186

Change-Id: I356ae998eed162b1f10537f3cd569dcca5ee71bd

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-10 09:23:26.000000000', 'message': 'Functional testing script password update

This patch includes a fix for the "configure_for_func_testing.sh" script.
When the guidelines are followed from the following link:
https://docs.openstack.org/neutron/ocata/devref/development.environment.html
the test script displays the following error:
ERROR 1045 (28000): Access denied for user 'root'@'localhost' (using password: YES).
The fix for this is to include the saved password in order to access the
MySQL database.

Change-Id: I6ab5cb3ef1583258cebec9f8f5966eda250a6367
Signed-off-by: Sara Nierodzik <sara.nierodzik@intel.com>

commit_message:
Functional testing script password update

This patch includes a fix for "configure_for_func_testing.sh" script.
When the guidelines are followed from the following link:
https://docs.openstack.org/neutron/latest/contributor/testing/testing.
html
the test script displays the following error:
ERROR 1045 (28000): Access denied for user 'root'@'localhost'
(using password: YES).
The fix for this is to include the saved password in order to access the
MySQL database.

Change-Id: I6ab5cb3ef1583258cebec9f8f5966eda250a6367
Bug-Link: https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1836028

commit_message:
Bump api_version from 1.35 to 1.36

Add support for 'tty' property on creating a container.
For backward-compatibility, we assigned 'tty' as 'interactive'
if 'interactive' is provided and 'tty' is not provided.

Change-Id: Ibd884ec42044a8ab46791e6f3d318f87dc95b10c

commit_message:
Cover the case when the container engine is not available.

In the case the container engine passed in tripleo_container_cli
isn't installed (for example: if we try to remove a docker container
when the instance has podman installed and docker isn't present) then
the role would fail. This patch includes a guard which in the case
the container engine passed in tripleo_container_cli doesn't exist
then nothing is done.
Besides, a check for the container being run in the docker-rm part
was missing, this check is being added too.

Change-Id: Ib5501321fef1a3921fbb17bcfabfb2f5c7c96c41
Related-Bug: #1836531

subject: [DNM] Print which images were skipped
messages: [{'account_id': 24072, 'date': '2019-07-18 12:40:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 24072, 'date': '2019-07-18 12:42:33.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned\n\nwrong changeid'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-18 12:40:56.000000000', 'message': "[DNM] Print which images were skipped

Normally information about skipped images are printed only when debug
information is enabled. but then whole lot of other details is provided
as well.

This patch shows which images were skipped (due to '--skip-parent'
option or being present in SKIPPED_IMAGES dict) so users will know what
they tried to build is disabled for selected distro/type/arch combo.

----

Current code is ugly and requires lot of optimizations:

- check_for_skipping() function needs to be written in recursive way
- debugs needs to be dropped (left as they are handy)
- sys.exit(1) needs to be dropped too ;D it is there as building phase
  is not needed for now
- 'openstack-base' is added to skipped to test how code behaves on
  larger tree of deps (I do development on aarch64)

Change-Id: I2e82fc717a0e2ff832582d94beda45947b827bd0
"}]
commit_message:
[DNM] Print which images were skipped

Normally information about skipped images are printed only when debug
information is enabled. but then whole lot of other details is provided
as well.

This patch shows which images were skipped (due to '--skip-parent'
option or being present in SKIPPED_IMAGES dict) so users will know what
they tried to build is disabled for selected distro/type/arch combo.

----

Current code is ugly and requires lot of optimizations:

- check_for_skipping() function needs to be written in recursive way
- debugs needs to be dropped (left as they are handy)
- sys.exit(1) needs to be dropped too ;D it is there as building phase
  is not needed for now
- 'openstack-base' is added to skipped to test how code behaves on
  larger tree of deps (I do development on aarch64)

Change-Id: I2e82fc717a0e2ff832582d94beda45947b827bd0

commit_message:
Add a v2 API endpoint to reset the state of different scopes

A new endpoint is available to admin users on ``PUT /v2/scope``
with relatively similar parameters that are to be found on the
``GET /v2/scope`` endpoint regarding filtering. This allows
end users to reset the scope state of several scopes at once
if they are willing to.

Story: 2005395
Task: 30790
Change-Id: I28ccd24c65163b3e1b59e478653b01b84f2bb1b0

When task/role files are included using include_tasks, tags are not
passed to the included tasks. As a result, tags like neutron-config
do not have the intended effect. This patch changes include_tasks
to import_tasks for all cases where dynamic vars or loops are not used

commit_message:
Convert dynamic includes to static imports

When task/role files are included using include_tasks, tags are not
passed to the included tasks. As a result, tags like neutron-config
do not have the intended effect. This patch changes include_tasks
to import_tasks for all cases where dynamic vars or loops are not used
so that tags are properly handled.

Reference -
https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/user_guide/playbooks_reuse.html
https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-ansible/+bug/1815043

Change-Id: Ifc210d2fc7f217105d83c0ad4f86a3939c6c93d3

commit_message:
Only validate admin and public host in local_subnet cidr

When multiple subnets are configured validations where failing
becuase the admin and public host addresses where checked
for all subnets. The admin and public host addresses should
only be validated against the cidr of the local_subnet.

Closes-Bug: #1791088

commit_message:
Add missing update_serial key to compute roles

I missed this the changes from I4ee0110a6c2b9466d81e37e5df27f5f81a6eceb5 when
rebasing I9f40a2a3561fcb1d1fec9d9c3c1f9cabaf02650c.

Add the missing key to the roles and add some validation to catch this.

Change-Id: I0f38df69777340ebbdc5c419f121524dbc74cad7
Related-bug: #1831617
Implements: blueprint nova-backend-per-role

Pike is in extended maintenance and is EOLed in terms of RDO.

To be accurate the version of RDO repo should match with the branch

commit_message:
Move CentOS to use RDO Stein packages

Pike is in extended maintenance and is EOLed in terms of RDO.

To be accurate the version of RDO repo should match with the branch
being used to build the containers. Anyway, IIUC, most python packages
are installed from source or pip, so i guess few packages should be
installed from distro repos.

Change-Id: I17354765c896fddc5962ee53d287d5a61abe8e11

commit_message:
set_ovs_hostconfigs on py3 fails with TypeError

In case of running devstack with USE_PYTHON3=True the command
neutron-odl-ovs-hostconfig --noovs_dpdk --bridge_mappings=public:
veth-pub-int fails with TypeError: a bytes-like object is required, not
'str'.

Change-Id: I2be64126e336f47676969abe4d81d5a739cb8599
Closes-Bug: #1822559

commit_message:
Fix CI failure

Correct params for the following functions when using kubernetes=9.0.0:
- delete_namespaced_pod
- delete_namespaced_service
- create_namespaced_deployment

Incease the timeout when waiting for the runtime created.

Change-Id: I74fd74a5a02811442c9eaff3f25fc03ee9312100
Story: #2006225
Task: #35824

commit_message:
Add Python 3 Train unit tests

This is a mechanically generated patch to ensure unit testing is in place
for all of the Tested Runtimes for Train.

See the Train python3-updates goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/python3-updates.html

As per below ML thread, we are good to drop the py35
testing also:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/005097.html

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/004647.html
[2]
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/train.html
Story: #2005924
Task: #34225

Change-Id: Ibda74052c2975d95f343f9e1f6c1a341aa1bbeb5

[{'created': '2018-09-03 06:11:23.000000000', 'message': 'New rerun events

Currently, all workflow actions, for example, start, pause, resume,
stop have own events except rerun. Even when we rerun a task, event
"TASK_LAUNCHED" doesn't propagate to a parent workflow and task.

Add new WORKFLOW_RERUN and TASK_RERUN events. These events propagate
to a parent workflow and task. You can find a example of new events in
the following tests:
* test_notify_rerun_task
* test_notify_rerun_nested_workflow

The recursive parameter was removed in the workflow set_state method
because it only is used in the rerun method. Recursive rerun was
extracted in the separate function.

commit_message:
New rerun events

Currently, all workflow actions, for example, start, pause, resume,
stop have own events except rerun. Even when we rerun a task, event
"TASK_LAUNCHED" doesn't propagate to a parent workflow and task.

Add new WORKFLOW_RERUN and TASK_RERUN events. These events propagate
to a parent workflow and task. You can find a example of new events in
the following tests:
* test_notify_rerun_task
* test_notify_rerun_nested_workflow

The recursive parameter was removed in the workflow set_state method
because it only is used in the rerun method. Recursive rerun was
extracted in the separate function.

Change-Id: Ib8bd3cf5c314ab4529260736cc0b7d792ce53171
Closes-Bug: #1790441
Signed-off-by: Vitalii Solodilov <mcdkr@yandex.ru>
Co-Authored-By: Oleg Ovcharuk <vgvoleg@gmail.com>

[{'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2019-03-29 16:38:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2019-03-29 16:54:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 29222, 'date': '2019-04-01 07:58:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-06-17 16:10:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2019-06-19 21:46:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

Unfortunately something in these regexes is not handling hyphenated project names correctly. For example, if I try to use django-thumborize (to pick a random project from pypi with a - in its name), I end up with django>=thumborize.

I have no idea what part of the change is causing that, I just pulled it down locally and tried adding a test string with a - in the name (which would be good case to include in this anyway). Probably it's assuming that the last part of a hyphenated name is the version regardless of whether there is a version specified or not.

FWIW, the test string I added was:

'-e git+git://git.pro-ject.org/django-thumborize#egg=django-thumborize'

The - in the domain doesn't seem to cause any problems, but the one in the egg name does.

Based on the bug report, I guess this isn't breaking it any worse than it already was, but it would be nice if there were some way to DTRT here."}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2019-06-25 15:05:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2019-06-25 15:07:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

 > The - in the domain doesn't seem to cause any problems, but the one
 > in the egg name does.
 > 
 > Based on the bug report, I guess this isn't breaking it any worse

 > DTRT here.

Normaly I now fix all these use case (multi-dash and version with tags, pre-realeases, meta, etc...).

See my latest changes (patch set 3)"}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2019-06-25 15:16:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2019-06-26 08:21:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
Fix parsing on egg names with dashes from git URLs

repository urls for non editables end up in the `install_requires`
list causing setup to fail. In this commit, all usable external urls get
inserted into the `dependency_links` list with the corresponding egg fragments
parsed into package names and versions (maintaining dashes if any) and added to
`install_requires` list.

Introduce parsing by using urlparse to extract properly the url
fragment.

Change-Id: If19576869fdf38e1768190c2d9c33f32504f7c54
Closes-Bug: #1373623

commit_message:
Add flows for gre tunnel in initialize track

The PPTP VPN will use Grev1 to translate, but seems the ovs
will set mark=1 for such packets, so we have to add one more
flow to match the +est status packets, then connectivity will
be fine.

Change-Id: I173dfc86cf6e879ee4608c0f085109a530d1d2b4
Closes-Bug: #1833175

commit_message:
Run os_tempest playbook for master only in multinode jobs

Currently multinode container build job runs against stable
branches also and clouds.yaml overcloud support landed in
master only. So it make sense to run os_tempest only on
master branch.

Change-Id: I8174551fdfc530157fb32f36ef107ed839139cdb
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Run os_tempest multinode job on master only

[1] converted containers-multinode job to run with
os_tempest for all releases instead of just master(only master
is ready for os_tempest in multinode jobs).
This patch adds a new containers multinode job with suffix
os-tempest. Old job is kept as it is as it's currently used
in multiple projects. Once all the projects switch to new
job, old job can be changed to not run on master.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/667390/

Change-Id: I8924505bd04c9a4792f9d85bb4e68622d9cf1e14
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

commit_message:
Add get_host_memory_stats in zvm driver

get_host_memory_stats is an abstract method which is newly
introduced in virt/driver.py to get the host's memory usage,
however, zvm driver doesn't implement it currently, and it
will report NotImplementedError in compute service.
This commit adds the implementation for it to fix this error
and it's tested on my local environment that works fine.

Change-Id: Iab3dc98fb804c08fba935e18d2c4d4d1d60dcd09
Signed-off-by: QingFeng Hao <haoqf@linux.vnet.ibm.com>

commit_message:
Remove support for Cisco UCSM plugin

The plugin doesn't have maintainers nor testing in recent releases,
let's remove it from the tree; and a composable service can be added
later if needed, out of tree.

Change-Id: I7edc7d1c817c5577a11effc6732fb3797574ebac

Until now, the generated inventory didn't take into account the "plan"
name we might pass to the `openstack tripleo validator run' CLI.

This change takes advantage of the tripleo-ansible-inventory script

Implements: blueprint validation-framework
'}]
commit_message:
Allow to pass "plan" name to tripleo-ansible-inventory script

Until now, the generated inventory didn't take into account the "plan"
name we might pass to the `openstack tripleo validator run' CLI.

This change takes advantage of the tripleo-ansible-inventory script
understanding of the TRIPLEO_PLAN_NAME environment variable in order to
generate the right inventory for the validations.

Change-Id: I370fd3a3a9e7fa76e3f5c6de7eaa9d4d76cc3edb
Implements: blueprint validation-framework

commit_message:
Create a podman role

This change creates a role using the podman content from
THT[0]. This role will run through all of the tasks found
within the THT file, and implements molecule tests coving
the functionality.

Test Matrix:
  - default - Runs through the role top to bottom
  - install - Runs only the install portions of the role
  - login - Runs only the login portion of the role

[0] - https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/master/deployment/podman/podman-baremetal-ansible.yaml

Task: 34598
Task: 34600
Task: 34601
Story: 2006017

Change-Id: Ia7fd611320d2f29b330a04484dca3146d74d8d82
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

Refactor code: move upgrade action into kolla_action module

Remove shyaml and te-broker lines

We no longer support  running with te-broker
and the shyaml install was causing install-deps
clashes.

commit_message:
ifdown does not work if no ifcfg file exist

ifdown happen before writing_config and if interface is up by
dhcp/dhclient it will not be down, ifdown relaying on ifcfg exist.

causing issue when pxe boot interface is also used as part of bond
interface.
interface is required to be down before adding to bond,
this patch validate that any physical interface will be in down state.

Change-Id: Ie096bf1296062744193bdcb9713ee42405e206d8
Closes-Bug: #1836024
topic: fix ifdown when there is no ifcfg file

commit_message:
Refactor code: move deploy action into kolla_action module

Now, kolla action(pull, deploy and os on) is completed in differentit
module, it result in many code duplicated, this PS to move action into
kolla_action module to reduce the duplicated code.

Change-Id: I25590cec5f5035046950950dc77a762f4b974a19
Co-Authored-By: jacky06 <zhang.min@99cloud.net>

commit_message:
segments: fix rp inventory update

The patch https://review.opendev.org/663980 made resource provider
inventory update failing with the assumption that inventory update
expects a dict with a key of the resource class, like resource provider
inventories update.
See the placement API-ref:
https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/placement/#update-resource-provider-inventory
https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/placement/#update-resource-provider-inventories

Change-Id: I7de1a947b864eb5ac57ebaca895f827d2e667443
Closes-Bug: #1836037
Related-Bug: #1828543

unnecessary spaces should be removed

1. when run koll-cli kolla action (like kolla-cli deploy), the log will
be displayed, lots of space will appear, it's not friendly for user, this
PS to fix it
2. update the cleanup description

commit_message:
Make the name parameter of the firewall policy optional

When creating a firewall or rule, the optional name parameter can be specified,
but the name parameter of the policy is mandatory. For uniformity, this patch
modifies it to be optional.

Change-Id: Ia179554d753951521fcdf4f40201fb4bac15bd5d

[{'created': '2019-07-17 13:55:59.000000000', 'message': 'Convert dynamic includes to static imports

When task/role files are included using include_tasks, tags are not
passed to the included tasks. As a result, tags like neutron-config
do not have the intended effect. This patch changes include_tasks
to import_tasks for all cases where dynamic vars or loops are not used
so that tags are properly handled.

Reference -
https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/user_guide/playbooks_reuse.html

Change-Id: I14bfdc0e488ffd2db1d0b82afd773674819ee0f4
'}]
commit_message:
Convert dynamic includes to static imports

When task/role files are included using include_tasks, tags are not
passed to the included tasks. As a result, tags like neutron-config
do not have the intended effect. This patch changes include_tasks
to import_tasks for all cases where dynamic vars or loops are not used
so that tags are properly handled.

Reference -
https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/user_guide/playbooks_reuse.html
https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-ansible/+bug/1815043

Change-Id: I14bfdc0e488ffd2db1d0b82afd773674819ee0f4

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-08 14:01:37.000000000', 'message': '[stable-only] Add local bindep.txt

As it was announced [1] global bindep-fallback.txt was removed and now
projects need to have a local bindep.txt to be able to install binary
dependencies for testing.

In test jobs the script tools/test-setup.sh is called which requires
mysql and postgres servers and clients to be installed.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-June/007272.html

Change-Id: I62a8049e1c51da12881e5c6e134c36efa42f9cd5
'}]
commit_message:
[stable-only] Add local bindep.txt

As it was announced [1] global bindep-fallback.txt was removed and now
projects need to have a local bindep.txt to be able to install binary
dependencies for testing.

In test jobs the script tools/test-setup.sh is called which requires
mysql and postgres servers and clients to be installed.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-June/007272.html

Change-Id: I62a8049e1c51da12881e5c6e134c36efa42f9cd5

commit_message:
Use systemd-journald instead of log files

This patch aims to migrate service from usage of regular syslog files
to journald. We also disable uwsgi logging, since it dublicates
requests that are logged by service itself.

Change-Id: I8be07495dd84f085de6d4409f2efd67a8359d82e

commit_message:
Convert dynamic includes to static imports

When task/role files are included using include_tasks, tags are not
passed to the included tasks. As a result, tags like neutron-config
do not have the intended effect. This patch changes include_tasks
to import_tasks for all cases where dynamic vars or loops are not used
so that tags are properly handled.

Reference -
https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/user_guide/playbooks_reuse.html
https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-ansible/+bug/1815043

Change-Id: I3a1fe5e065b9dbb218acdab06c1d1dac38ea7e64

commit_message:
Move tripleo-ci-centos-7-containers-multinode to os_tempest

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/664586/ adds support for
using overcloud os_cloud and also we are moving to os_tempest
for running tempest tests. let's reuse the same feature here
and tests the stuff.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/667323/
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/665604

Change-Id: I2e4afef449460d8ed2c60998178fd194090c9585
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Use systemd-journald instead of log files

This patch aims to migrate service from usage of regular syslog files
to journald. We also disable uwsgi logging, since it dublicates
requests that are logged by service itself.

Change-Id: I83b54a175b15932036755c2673993990492592e8

subject: Convert dynamic includes to static imports
messages: [{'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2019-07-17 15:50:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2019-07-17 17:44:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2019-07-18 05:53:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-17 15:50:31.000000000', 'message': 'Convert dynamic includes to static imports

When task/role files are included using include_tasks, tags are not
passed to the included tasks. As a result, tags like neutron-config
do not have the intended effect. This patch changes include_tasks
to import_tasks for all cases where dynamic vars or loops are not used
so that tags are properly handled.

Reference -
https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/user_guide/playbooks_reuse.html
https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-ansible/+bug/1815043

Change-Id: I7e529e9b4d23ffe8658c4dcdf4e98989d0f84f3f
'}]
commit_message:
Convert dynamic includes to static imports

When task/role files are included using include_tasks, tags are not
passed to the included tasks. As a result, tags like neutron-config
do not have the intended effect. This patch changes include_tasks
to import_tasks for all cases where dynamic vars or loops are not used
so that tags are properly handled.

Reference -
https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/user_guide/playbooks_reuse.html
https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-ansible/+bug/1815043

Change-Id: I7e529e9b4d23ffe8658c4dcdf4e98989d0f84f3f

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-12 14:11:16.000000000', 'message': 'Fix ironic inspector iPXE boot with UEFI

The ironic inspector iPXE configuration includes the following kernel
argument:

initrd=agent.ramdisk

However, the ramdisk is actually called ironic-agent.initramfs, so the
argument should be:

initrd=ironic-agent.initramfs

In BIOS boot mode this does not cause a problem, but for compute nodes
with UEFI enabled, it seems to be more strict about this, and fails to
boot.

Change-Id: Ic84f3b79fdd3cd1730ca2fb79c11c7a4e4d824de
Closes-Bug: #1836375
'}]
commit_message:
Fix ironic inspector iPXE boot with UEFI

The ironic inspector iPXE configuration includes the following kernel
argument:

initrd=agent.ramdisk

However, the ramdisk is actually called ironic-agent.initramfs, so the
argument should be:

initrd=ironic-agent.initramfs

In BIOS boot mode this does not cause a problem, but for compute nodes
with UEFI enabled, it seems to be more strict about this, and fails to
boot.

Change-Id: Ic84f3b79fdd3cd1730ca2fb79c11c7a4e4d824de
Closes-Bug: #1836375

commit_message:
Create needed infrastructure to switch scheduler implementations

* After this patch we can switch scheduler implementations in the
  configuration. All functionality related to scheduling jobs is
  now expressed vi the internal API classes Scheduler and
  SchedulerJob. Patch also adds another entry point into setup.cfg
  where we can register a new scheduler implementation.
* The new scheduler (which is now called DefaultScheduler) still
  should be considered experimental and requires a lot of testing
  and optimisations.
* Fixed and refactored "with-items" tests. Before the patch they
  were breaking the "black box" testing principle and relied on
  on some either purely implementation or volatile data (e.g.
  checks of the internal 'capacity' property)
* Fixed all other relevant tests.

Change-Id: I340f886615d416a1db08e4516f825d200f76860d

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-11 02:47:39.000000000', 'message': "Update fip with a new port will works in ovn immediately

For now, update fip with a new port doesn't work as we expected,
because the related dnat_and_snat rule haven't produced in OVN
immediately(it needs about 5 min). As we found, it caused by the
'upated_floatingip' method, which including '_delete_floating'
and '_create_or_update_floatingip' in the same transcation.
The '_delete_floating' will execute after '_update_floating',
so the dnat_and_snat rule disapperd in OVN.
I added a new transaction for '_create_or_update_floatingip' to
avoid the dnat_and_snat couldn't produce immediately.

Change-Id: I1cf19e4c4a63f4410cb74157b56a6a478d4f9c22
Co-authored-by: Taoyunxiang <taoyunxiang@cmss.chinamobile.com>
Closes-bug: 1833820

commit_message:
Update fip with a new port will produce dnat_and_snat rule in time

For now, update fip with a new port doesn't work as we expected,
because the related dnat_and_snat rule haven't produced in OVN
immediately(it needs about 5 min). As we found, it caused by the
'upated_floatingip' method, which including '_delete_floating'
and '_create_or_update_floatingip' in the same transcation.
The '_delete_floating' will execute after '_update_floating',
so the dnat_and_snat rule disapperd in OVN.
I added a new transaction for '_create_or_update_floatingip' to
avoid the dnat_and_snat couldn't produce immediately.

Change-Id: I1cf19e4c4a63f4410cb74157b56a6a478d4f9c22
Co-authored-by: Taoyunxiang <taoyunxiang@cmss.chinamobile.com>
Closes-bug: 1833820

commit_message:
Refactor code: move reconfigure action into kolla_action module

Now, kolla action(pull, deploy and os on) is completed in differentit
module, it result in many code duplicated, this PS to move action into
kolla_action module to reduce the duplicated code.

Change-Id: I7f0f94cef3670c4d0b4c2df90b35c1dca5644f1b
Co-Authored-By: jacky06 <zhang.min@99cloud.net>

commit_message:
Fix cryptsetup --pbkdf-memory failures

A recent patch[1] added --pbkdf-memory to the cryptsetup command line
to limit the memory cryptsetup is using. However, some distros use
an older version of cryptsetup that does not need this setting.
This patch adds logic to detect this and run the commands without
--pbkdf-memory.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/663784

Change-Id: I9e0debcbfe6ceeff0012c827d70d80d938b5a2fb
Story: 2006066
Task: 34782

commit_message:
Refactor code: move pull action into kolla_action module

Now, kolla action(pull, deploy and os on) is completed in differentit
module, it result in many code duplicated, this PS to move action into
kolla_action module to reduce the duplicated code.

Co-Authored-By: jacky06 <zhang.min@99cloud.net>

commit_message:
Dropping the py35 testing

All the integration testing has been moved to
Bionic now[1] and py3.5 is not tested runtime for
Train or stable/stein[2].

As per below ML thread, we are good to drop the py35
testing now:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/005097.html

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/004647.html
[2]
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html

Change-Id: Ib693695c311fc6ee8695cd4a145a2f34fcb043a2

https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/train.html

'}]
commit_message:
Dropping the py35 testing

All the integration testing has been moved to
Bionic now[1] and py3.5 is not tested runtime for
Train or stable/stein[2].

As per below ML thread, we are good to drop the py35
testing now:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/005097.html

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/004647.html
[2]
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/train.html

Change-Id: I65dd357580053f8dcfbead487a2ecb3dab58839b

commit_message:
Ensure we're raising proper exceptions

This change ensures our use of the `process.execute` method from
"oslo_concurrency" always checks the return codes of a given command.
While the library is assumed to do this already, this change
enforces our expected behavior.

We're also changing our use of futures to return when there's
an exception. The build_all method was blocking until all
jobs were completed. Blocking on pipeline completion results
in us masking exceptions that may be raised duing the job
execution. To ensure we're capturing errors in our build
process the wait function now return on the first exception;
More on the futures constants can be seen here:[0]. The
return values will now be evaluated to ensure all jobs
completed successfully.

Unit tests have been added to ensure we're not breaking the
build all method and that it raise appropriate exceptions
when errors are encountered.

[0] - https://docs.python.org/3/library/concurrent.futures.html#module-functions

Related-Bug: #1836265
Change-Id: Ia05140142fa59e5b252cd92801244e4fc02f4bbc
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fixed roles_path in ansible.cfg

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/671248/ updates the
action_plugins path for config_template and in order to detect
the config_template plugin path, we need to update the same
so that it will work with os_tempest job.

Change-Id: Ia57ea708ff6faeeff138674452953d066a456156
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

Add Python 3 Train unit tests

This is a mechanically generated patch to ensure unit testing is in place
for all of the Tested Runtimes for Train.

See the Train python3-updates goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/python3-updates.html

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-15 19:31:36.000000000', 'message': "Normalize protocol number 1 to 58 for IPv6

The security group code was changed recently to always
normalize IPv6 ICMP protocol names to 'ipv6-icmp', but it
did not cover when a number is used instead. Normalize
protocol number 1 to 58 for IPv6 ICMP as well.

Change-Id: Ife8263196f3d678d8455f07834c9f6c1330acc00
Closes-bug: #1582500
"}]
commit_message:
Normalize protocol number 1 to 58 for IPv6

The security group code was changed recently to always
normalize IPv6 ICMP protocol names to 'ipv6-icmp', but it
did not cover when a number is used instead. Normalize
protocol number 1 to 58 for IPv6 ICMP as well.

Change-Id: Ife8263196f3d678d8455f07834c9f6c1330acc00
Closes-bug: #1582500

[{'created': '2019-07-17 10:18:42.000000000', 'message': 'Remove Bugday from navbar

It seems like bugday was removed from the navbar in all other places
on status.openstack.org so this commit removes it from the menu.
It also seems like there is no backend configured for "/bugday"

Change-Id: I67e9271450ee7c98887759d0224cd26f72adabba
'}]
commit_message:
Remove Bugday from navbar

It seems like bugday was removed from the navbar in all other places
on status.openstack.org so this commit removes it from the menu.
It also seems like there is no backend configured for "/bugday"

Change-Id: I67e9271450ee7c98887759d0224cd26f72adabba

commit_message:
Add support for VxFlex OS 3.0 to VxFlex OS driver

Prepare driver code for future VxFlex OS 3.0 release.
Add support for VxFlex OS 3.0 volume compression.

Change-Id: Ica0467e18d5ccd216ed12ef8e23982ab9a58fd0f

commit_message:
Fix IPv6 tests if ipv6-private-subnet is stateless

If the cloud has configured the ipv6-private-subnet to use stateless
addressing, such as slaac or dhcpv6-stateless, we need to not request
a fixed IP from neutron.

Story: 2006164
Task: 35674

Change-Id: I27e82b34a39bea8a987724e013081079f236894d

commit_message:
remove support for deprecated options in VxFlex OS driver

VxFlex OS driver drops support for options, which
were marked as deprecated more than one release ago.
Remove config options:
 sio_protection_domain_id
 sio_protection_domain_name
 sio_storage_pool_name
 sio_storage_pool_id
Remove volume type options:
 sio:sp_name
 sio:sp_id
 sio:pd_name
 sio:pd_id
 sio:provisioning_type
 sio:iops_limit
 sio:bandwidth_limit

Change-Id: I8df09848e6df0cd4ade7d96af8ccc3ba6783794b

commit_message:
Failure in get_sensor_data() of 'redfish' management interface

This patch fixes following issues in get_sensor_data():
- Uses 'identity' field instead of unsupported field 'member_id' in
Sushy's PowerSupplyListField
- get_members() is not supported for Sushy's list fields like
FansListField and TemperaturesListField

Change-Id: I534d78fa9c9fc2573c7b6e15c3356da234f063ec
Story: 2006229
Task: 35830

commit_message:
nova: switch to python3 for build

Sphinx 2.x has dropped support for python2, so start using the python3
versions of these packages which should get them all in sync.

Change-Id: I74d4e729d90a76ca47fd1e9dc5d3d2f626f3a820

commit_message:
Drop support for Ubuntu Xenial

Attempts to deploy on Xenial will fail and references to Xenial are
removed from the documentation

Change-Id: I1cbbf64d0724aa6d21da7ec1cc38a9c8e4ff8851

commit_message:
Prevent unnecessary nova-compute restarts on ceph_changed

Nova-compute service restarts make sense only on relation
config updates received from the ceph-mon leader.

Also, synced charm helpers as PR #347 is used as
part of the fix.

Change-Id: I406f369b1e376db82b8683fd48fbe4de106da16f
Closes-bug: #1835045

commit_message:
vif: Remove dead minimum libvirt checks

Our minimum for libvirt is now 3.0.0 while our QEMU minimum is 2.8.0,
meaning some checks for older versions can be removed.

Change-Id: Ibecdfb1e903d3c1f711e1d61212be00176110a9b
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
MetricsQdr: Build sslProfiles without internal TLS

sslProfiles submitted as a parameter are not created when internal_tls
is not true. This change adds the ability also create ad-hoc
sslProfiles when internal TLS is not used.

Change-Id: I07b79c398ea900f388e75d25eddd8853abb9e5fb
(cherry picked from commit ae439aa39b7fbe724a87c402b11799e754bccdb9)
(cherry picked from commit c7da8495e6dc22da7a36b9061d1d375eaca45430)
(cherry picked from commit 042a34fa4fb041bcdd270db4133b6af242122b2b)

[{'created': '2019-07-17 13:30:32.000000000', 'message': 'Use systemd-journald instead of log files

This patch aims to migrate service from usage of regular syslog files
to journald. We also disable uwsgi logging, since it dublicates
requests that are logged by service itself.

Change-Id: I4168cd484ef52cc7b47efdbcc26d3d3550d28654
'}]
commit_message:
Use systemd-journald instead of log files

This patch aims to migrate service from usage of regular syslog files
to journald. We also disable uwsgi logging, since it dublicates
requests that are logged by service itself.

Change-Id: I4168cd484ef52cc7b47efdbcc26d3d3550d28654

If running 'kayobe overcloud introspection data save' in an environment
where nodes have been registered in the seed's ironic service manually
(rather than through auto-discovery), previously the bifrost ansible
inventory would not have been populated.

This change ensures the bifrost ansible inventory exists prior to
collecting introspection data.

Change-Id: I2ad53aa0db3bab8db6d6d9de4b00c5dac756fb15
(cherry picked from commit c7ab69b38b8eebda2620f53366e4a9156d431f3a)

where nodes have been registered in the seed's ironic service manually
(rather than through auto-discovery), previously the bifrost ansible
inventory would not have been populated.

This change ensures the bifrost ansible inventory exists prior to
collecting introspection data.

Change-Id: I2ad53aa0db3bab8db6d6d9de4b00c5dac756fb15
(cherry picked from commit c7ab69b38b8eebda2620f53366e4a9156d431f3a)

commit_message:
Fix overcloud introspection data save

If running 'kayobe overcloud introspection data save' in an environment
where nodes have been registered in the seed's ironic service manually
(rather than through auto-discovery), previously the bifrost ansible
inventory would not have been populated.

This change ensures the bifrost ansible inventory exists prior to
collecting introspection data.

Change-Id: I2ad53aa0db3bab8db6d6d9de4b00c5dac756fb15
(cherry picked from commit c7ab69b38b8eebda2620f53366e4a9156d431f3a)

commit_message:
Remove mentions of UUID Keystone token provider

Keystone removed the UUID token provider in Rocky and Kolla Ansible
removed support for configuring it. This commit reflects these changes
in Kayobe.

Change-Id: I5a2c71e7e65f99687437f6a26a0c4a942022f4e9
(cherry picked from commit 5d82c788a8a3af943abf4001ab393bc490d9ad3a)

commit_message:
Updating Jinja filters to conform to Ansible 2.5+

Since Ansible 2.5, the use of jinja tests as filters has been deprecated.

I've run the script provided by the ansible team to 'fix' the jinja filters
to conform to the newer syntax.

This fixes the deprecation warnings.

Change-Id: I775c849c944f82bdfc779c8c530346e7ebedbd2a

commit_message:
Merge parameters and templates when resetting stack status

We keep the new template in the prev_raw_template_id. When setting
the stacks to FAILED we should also merge the templates for both
existing and backup stack.

Change-Id: Ic67a4833672d1c562980ee19fd8071f84dd9500a
Task: 35842

commit_message:
Change python3.5 job to python3.7 job on Stein+

This is a mechanically generated patch to add a unit test job running
under Python 3.7 and drop the Python 3.5 unit test job.

python3.5 was the only supported python3 version on Xenial. Now that
we have Bionic nodes supporting python3.6 and python3.7, let's switch
to testing with python3.7 in addition to python3.6 in Stein and
beyond.

See ML discussion here [1] for context.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135626.html

Change-Id: I34c8f686bdbe5a9fc935fd672bde3fd8e3b424e8
Story: #2004073
Task: #27446

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-18 19:52:01.000000000', 'message': "Floating IP does not work with VLAN tenant networks

When trying to use the Floating IP address of an instance
in a OVN-DVR setup while using VLAN tenant network type
the traffic does not pass. This is because of limitations
with VLAN tenant network types, which doesn't support
distributed VLAN routing.

The problem is the external_mac should not be set in the
NAT table for the Floating IP which belongs to the logical
port of a VLAN tenant logical switch. Otherwise, the compute
node which is binding the logical port will send the GARP
where as the routing for VLAN tenant networks is centralized.

Change-Id: I406204fc751387c02517286c87fe45533d70b93d
Closes-bug: #1828891
(cherry picked from commit c5aef51edc9843db605303ec8bd8610b6c55e9c2)
"}, {'created': '2019-06-19 19:42:59.000000000', 'message': "Floating IP does not work with VLAN tenant networks

When trying to use the Floating IP address of an instance
in a OVN-DVR setup while using VLAN tenant network type
the traffic does not pass. This is because of limitations
with VLAN tenant network types, which doesn't support
distributed VLAN routing.

The problem is the external_mac should not be set in the
NAT table for the Floating IP which belongs to the logical
port of a VLAN tenant logical switch. Otherwise, the compute
node which is binding the logical port will send the GARP
where as the routing for VLAN tenant networks is centralized.

Conflicts:
    networking_ovn/tests/unit/l3/test_l3_ovn.py

Change-Id: I406204fc751387c02517286c87fe45533d70b93d
Closes-bug: #1828891
(cherry picked from commit c5aef51edc9843db605303ec8bd8610b6c55e9c2)
"}]
commit_message:
Floating IP does not work with VLAN tenant networks

When trying to use the Floating IP address of an instance
in a OVN-DVR setup while using VLAN tenant network type
the traffic does not pass. This is because of limitations
with VLAN tenant network types, which doesn't support
distributed VLAN routing.

The problem is the external_mac should not be set in the
NAT table for the Floating IP which belongs to the logical
port of a VLAN tenant logical switch. Otherwise, the compute
node which is binding the logical port will send the GARP
where as the routing for VLAN tenant networks is centralized.

Conflicts:
    networking_ovn/tests/unit/l3/test_l3_ovn.py

Change-Id: I406204fc751387c02517286c87fe45533d70b93d
Closes-bug: #1828891
(cherry picked from commit c5aef51edc9843db605303ec8bd8610b6c55e9c2)

commit_message:
Add microstack project.

microstack is a basic Openstack deploy packaged in a snap!

It's currently hosted on github, but we're moving it to opendev to
take advantage of the zuul gate, among other things.

Change-Id: I0bd5ba5404989ca7ad4f62afe6ac177e1d95f45b

commit_message:
Handle FIP for Loadbalancer VIP

If a floating IP is associated to Loadbalancer VIP
then given floating IP should be added as vip under
loadbalancer external_ids column.

Closes-Bug: #1834453

Change-Id: Ibb958ea5acaaf07af8ebed5d9552036db9469346
Signed-off-by: Numan Siddique <nusiddiq@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Maciej J√≥zefczyk <mjozefcz@redhat.com>

This is a mechanically generated patch to ensure unit testing is in place
for all of the Tested Runtimes for Train.

See the Train python3-updates goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/python3-updates.html

messages: [{'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2019-07-10 18:37:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2019-07-17 10:26:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2019-07-17 14:56:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2019-07-17 15:14:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-07-17 15:58:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-10 18:37:41.000000000', 'message': 'WIP support upcoming forcing of tls priorities

Change-Id: I1971810f6a90f244ed5ced972a5fe7fde29dde86
'}, {'created': '2019-07-17 10:26:26.000000000', 'message': 'WIP support upcoming forcing of tls priorities

Change-Id: I1971810f6a90f244ed5ced972a5fe7fde29dde86
'}, {'created': '2019-07-17 14:56:42.000000000', 'message': 'Support upcoming forcing of tls priorities

Via pacemaker's commit a4ef0bb141ceb9364465e016eb471cf1494f941a
"Feature: remote: allow run-time configurable TLS priorities"

It allows to set the desired GnuTLS cipher priorities in the
PCMK_tls_priorities sysconfig environment file.

See https://gnutls.org/manual/html_node/Priority-Strings.html for what
values can be passed. Let's let an operator specify that string if
needed.

Tested with the other tripleo patches here:
https://review.opendev.org/#/q/topic:pcmk_tls+(status:open+OR+status:merged)

and correctly obtained:
A) When set to 'test'
/etc/sysconfig/pacemaker:PCMK_tls_priorities=test
B) No setting at all when unset
C) The correct env variable in some of the containers:
[root@controller-0 ~]# docker inspect haproxy-bundle-docker-1 |grep -i tls_pr
  "PCMK_tls_priorities=test",

Change-Id: I1971810f6a90f244ed5ced972a5fe7fde29dde86
'}]
commit_message:
Support upcoming forcing of tls priorities

Via pacemaker's commit a4ef0bb141ceb9364465e016eb471cf1494f941a
"Feature: remote: allow run-time configurable TLS priorities"

It allows to set the desired GnuTLS cipher priorities in the
PCMK_tls_priorities sysconfig environment file.

See https://gnutls.org/manual/html_node/Priority-Strings.html for what
values can be passed. Let's let an operator specify that string if
needed.

Tested with the other tripleo patches here:
https://review.opendev.org/#/q/topic:pcmk_tls+(status:open+OR+status:merged)

and correctly obtained:
A) When set to 'test'
/etc/sysconfig/pacemaker:PCMK_tls_priorities=test
B) No setting at all when unset
C) The correct env variable in some of the containers:
[root@controller-0 ~]# docker inspect haproxy-bundle-docker-1 |grep -i tls_pr
  "PCMK_tls_priorities=test",

Change-Id: I1971810f6a90f244ed5ced972a5fe7fde29dde86

[{'created': '2019-07-03 22:12:28.000000000', 'message': "Add exercises for intern applicants

At the Train PTG, we discussed[1] what we could do to continue to
participate in open source internship programs like Outreachy while
keeping the high volume of applicants manageable. Outreachy requires
applicants to submit a contribution to the project they are applying
for, but we rarely have sufficient numbers of low-hanging-fruit tasks to
assign to all of them to allow all of them to make useful contributions.
Instead, we propose to give them exercises that most likely will not be
merged into keystone itself. These exercises are much more difficult
than typo fix tasks, and can be assigned to multiple people without
concern for applicants stepping on each others' toes. They can also help
new contributors get familiar with the architecture of keystone and the
development workflow, and encourages them to interact with the team.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/keystone-train-ptg-outreachy-brainstorm

Change-Id: I615b1c029db59a1f9d8548dc0a80faa5c4150f2a

commit_message:
Add exercises for intern applicants

At the Train PTG, we discussed[1] what we could do to continue to
participate in open source internship programs like Outreachy while
keeping the high volume of applicants manageable. Outreachy requires
applicants to submit a contribution to the project they are applying
for, but we rarely have sufficient numbers of low-hanging-fruit tasks to
assign to all of them to allow all of them to make useful contributions.
Instead, we propose to give them exercises that most likely will not be
merged into keystone itself. These exercises are much more difficult
than typo fix tasks, and can be assigned to multiple people without
concern for applicants stepping on each others' toes. They can also help
new contributors get familiar with the architecture of keystone and the
development workflow, and encourages them to interact with the team.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/keystone-train-ptg-outreachy-brainstorm

Change-Id: I615b1c029db59a1f9d8548dc0a80faa5c4150f2a

in this patch to drop any older deleted port.

cleanup, with an execution interval of 1 day too.

commit_message:
[DHCP] Implement an aging method for deleted_ports

When a port is deleted, is added to the NetworkCache instance
as a "deleted port". This set of ports is used by the DHCP agent
to mark out as "stalled" any message received with this port
in the payload.

Eventually, each deleted port should be dropped from this set
depending on when was deleted. A timeout of 1 day has been defined
in this patch to drop any older deleted port.

A "loopingcall.FixedIntervalLoopingCall" executes the deleted port
cleanup, with an execution interval of 1 day too.

Co-Authored-By: Rodolfo Alonso Hernandez <ralonsoh@readhat.com>
Partial-Bug: #1732458

Change-Id: I0bca03a67e8b0ff8f508cf59383340a13724e51c

> Based on https://review.opendev.org/#/c/424454/ we are not handling race conditions.

I'm not sure what you mean.  It looks like, in that review, Walt pointed out that there is likely a race between initialize_connection() and terminate_connection() for this driver.

I suspect this means that here, locks are needed.

This can be done by adding decorators like
    @coordination.synchronized('3par-{volume[id]}')

to the initialize_connection and terminate_connection methods to lock on a per-volume basis to prevent these race conditions."}, {'account_id': 29502, 'date': '2019-07-12 09:27:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

> > Based on https://review.opendev.org/#/c/424454/ we are not
 > handling race conditions.
 > 
 > I'm not sure what you mean.  It looks like, in that review, Walt
 > pointed out that there is likely a race between initialize_connection()
 > and terminate_connection() for this driver.
 > 
 > I suspect this means that here, locks are needed.
 > 
 > This can be done by adding decorators like
 > @coordination.synchronized('3par-{volume[id]}')
 > 
 > to the initialize_connection and terminate_connection methods to
 > lock on a per-volume basis to prevent these race conditions.

Hi Eric,

I tested this without the synchronized lock. I executed parallel attach and detach calls and I didn't notice a race condition.

nova volume-attach inst1 78bb91a8-219c-48bd-9f3a-f8f1b2ce5bff & nova volume-attach inst2 135f7439-4e86-41c0-8430-09a60a76b2a4

Please let me know if this test is fine to re-produce race condition or not."}, {'account_id': 29502, 'date': '2019-07-12 09:38:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

Hi Eric,

I have one more question wrt support matrix. Currently, multiattach feature is not supported by HPE 3par driver. From T release it will be part of the feature matrix. What shall I be doing to update the matrix doc?'}, {'account_id': 4523, 'date': '2019-07-13 11:52:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

(1 comment)

I don't think that test really tells you much, because the race isn't going to happen _most_ of the time.

But the fact that it can happen based on analyzing how the code works means that it should be prevented by adding a lock.


For the support matrix, yes, you can update that with this patch."}, {'account_id': 4523, 'date': '2019-07-13 12:26:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 29502, 'date': '2019-07-13 15:07:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

 > I don't think that test really tells you much, because the race

 > 
 >

Hi Eric,

Need some input on how do I update the matrix. Is there a guideline for this?"}, {'account_id': 27615, 'date': '2019-07-14 12:04:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)

Few NIT's and suggestions inline,
The refactoring doesn't harm and can stay in this patch but it is good practice to keep related changes in a patch so the motive isn't confused.
You can update the support matrix here[1] to show multiattach is supported in hpe3par driver.

'}, {'created': '2019-07-04 11:27:59.000000000', 'message': "HPE 3PAR - Fix detach of multiattach volumes
Closes-bug: #1834660

Currently, volume detach call for the first instance deletes the luns
and host entry from 3par and due to this the other instances still
attached to volume loose the connectivity. This causes the volume to
go in 'detaching' state.

Change-Id: I31658cf986602d056978c29e12c0fc3cdbac7150

commit_message:
HPE 3PAR - Fix detach of multiattach volumes

Currently, volume detach call for the first instance deletes the luns
and host entry from 3par and due to this the other instances still
attached to volume loose the connectivity. This causes the volume to
go in 'detaching' state.

Change-Id: I31658cf986602d056978c29e12c0fc3cdbac7150
Closes-bug: #1834660

commit_message:
Convert dynamic includes to static imports

When task/role files are included using include_tasks, tags are not
passed to the included tasks. As a result, tags like neutron-config
do not have the intended effect. This patch changes include_tasks
to import_tasks for all cases where dynamic vars or loops are not used
so that tags are properly handled.

Reference -
https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/user_guide/playbooks_reuse.html
https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-ansible/+bug/1815043

Change-Id: I6d906c095b3c039fc3789e37dca03f4b734aab46

commit_message:
add some more not buildable images

Cyborg-agent binaries are only provided as x86-64 rpm packages.

CentOS/aarch64 does not have 'mongodb' in EPEL.

Ubuntu/aarch64 lacks 'sensu' package.

Change-Id: I0fd668018b37e1d64782fd32ff3846a688c4e915

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-29 17:36:34.000000000', 'message': 'Fix IPA image path used for TLS supplemental node

When deploying with a supplemental node to use TLS everywhere, a
provisioning script is used to customize the IPA image that is used
to create the supplemental node.  Most of this script uses the
$VMIMGIPA variable to refer to the image path, but one spot instead
uses the {{ ssh_user }} variable to determine the image path.  This
can result in an incorrect path depending on the user who is running
quickstart.sh, which results in a failed deployment.

This patch uses the $VMIMGIPA variable consistently in the TLS VM
provisioning script.

Change-Id: I9cf8ddf568af880ff5597006685958445e8b2569

commit_message:
Fix IPA image path used for TLS supplemental node

When deploying with a supplemental node to use TLS everywhere, a
provisioning script is used to customize the IPA image that is used
to create the supplemental node.  Most of this script uses the
$VMIMGIPA variable to refer to the image path, but one spot instead
uses the {{ ssh_user }} variable to determine the image path.  This
can result in an incorrect path depending on the user who is running
quickstart.sh, which results in a failed deployment.

This patch uses the $VMIMGIPA variable consistently in the TLS VM
provisioning script.

Change-Id: I9cf8ddf568af880ff5597006685958445e8b2569

commit_message:
Adding dependency in cinder for keystone-api

The patch adds dependency in cinder for create_internal_tenant job which
uses openstack client to create internal_project_name and internal_user_name
but if identity server is not ready yet the job crashes therefore cinder-volume
doesn't work as well.

Change-Id: I4386f127b834a9777093ac1d3c269937947c7bcf

commit_message:
Move db class definitions before orm relationships to those classes

This is to fix race conditions on neutron server init.
Please see bug for details.
Also removes redundant relationship in BGPVPNPortAssociation
as it is defined in BGPVPNPortAssociationRoute as well.

Change-Id: Ibe51e51799c59fae1a8b412fd3d3535bbc96aa20
Partial-Bug: #1824299
Related-Bug: #1815564

commit_message:
Remove backend async migrate spec

This was merged in Newton and then moved to Stein, but has not been
implemented yet. It doesn't appear anyone is going to pick up this idea
and follow it through, so we should just remove the spec to make sure
there is no confusion about it.

Change-Id: Icb7223ceb962a14d7a9bebdcc2834689e7e5d33b
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add friendly event hints for logging

When creating a network log with the '--event' parameter, it is
impossible to know which parameter values can be specified, and it
is necessary to add a prompt.

Change-Id: I6aa4f95b650cdc7b04e74b851a78a2ae42fc288a

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-17 12:16:14.000000000', 'message': "Drop legacy neutron L3 HA tool

Since neutron has built-in L3 HA for fair time and is pretty stable,
this patch aims to drop custom legacy ha toolset.
This allows to drop creation of neutron_log_dir when it's defined.

Change-Id: I36bb52248be7110b9af9b4aa9e4e7888a3af5eea
"}]
commit_message:
Drop legacy neutron L3 HA tool

Since neutron has built-in L3 HA for fair time and is pretty stable,
this patch aims to drop custom legacy ha toolset.
This allows to drop creation of neutron_log_dir when it's defined.

Change-Id: I36bb52248be7110b9af9b4aa9e4e7888a3af5eea

-slow job is running only tempest tests marked as "slow" by QA team.

commit_message:
Add new tempest-full multinode job to check queue

This patch adds new multinode job running tempest-full tests.
It is named "networking-ovn-tempest-full-multinode-ovs-master" and
runs ovs from master branch.

Change-Id: I4ef9a4b9e8df779dad38d394c4bb1281cbe7bc10

Changes have been made to the setup.cfg file so that this repository
can be packaged (rpm, deb, etc) easier. This change also updates the
project layout so that we're publishing the code to tarballs, which

Change-Id: I7f3ee2a847995e5572f1241f3952ed2720a23958
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Update setup for easier packaging and publish a tarball

Changes have been made to the setup.cfg file so that this repository
can be packaged (rpm, deb, etc) easier. This change also updates the
project layout so that we're publishing the code to tarballs, which
again, makes it easy to package config_template for distros.

Change-Id: I7f3ee2a847995e5572f1241f3952ed2720a23958
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>
